Reviews.Title: “St Patty's weekend in the Chi at the Sax”
Reviews.Author: Sweetnsassy3578
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just recently went to Chicago for St. Patrick's day and stayed at the Sax. I have always wanted to stay there and when I received an email with the special they were having I canceled my other reservations and made ours at the Sax. It is a beautiful hotel and we were very pleased. The location is great and the staff was helpful and very friendly. I would have liked to have a view of the river but we didn't indicate that to them so it really isn't a bad thing but the only thing I can say that would be even close to a negative. Would recommend this hotel to all. Great place to stay with all its charm and style.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Rockadash
Reviews.Content: Stayed on night in February of 2012. Easy to find, nice location and very clean. Bed was not particularly comfortable. Staff was very helpful. I had a corner room on the 10th floor and it was quiet. Nice view out the window of downtown and the water.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: CathyHS
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for various downtown activities with easy walking access to River North, Michigan Ave, and The Loop. I thought the decor and atmosphere were pretty fun. My only annoyance while staying there was that the ice machine did not work on several floors, though the front desk quickly sent someone to drop some off at the room when I called. I would definitely stay here again, but probably only for a special occasion or if I find another good deal online.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CL949
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to stay at the SAX hotel from March 2-4 for my boyfriend's birthday. The service was excellent and hotel staff were very helpful. We had a delayed flight from California and so we checked later than expected. We not only were greeted we were also upgraded to a higher floor. So, thank you for that. The hotel's decor was very trendy and the room was clean. My only con was that our bed was not as comfortable as we hoped, and the pillows were really small for a KING size bed, but other than that you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Girls' Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Thebic_11
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 6 friends staying at the Sax to celebrate a birthday and were lucky enough to find a great deal on Travelzoo, $119/night with two complimentary drink tickets for the Crimson Lounge. The decor was unique and fun and added to the luxe feel of the place. The bathroom was huge and gave us a nice place to dress up before going out to a fantastic sushi place a few blocks away. The location of the Sax is great, really close to a variety of shopping (loved going to Nordstroms and Marbles the Brain Store) and restaurants. We really wanted to go to the House of Blues Gospel Brunch in the morning, which was right around the corner from the hotel, but it was sold out well in advance. The concierge recommended The Emerald Loop, a nearby Irish Pub, which was excellent! An all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet for $9.95 in downtown Chicago? It exists, and it is awesome. The only downsides to the hotel were the puzzling lack of towels and pillows for all four guests (only 3 towels/room and one small pillow per guest), though extra pillows and towels were promptly brought up when we called the front desk. All in all a great deal, and I would gladly stay here again if I found a room at a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: grecianadventurer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from a TravelZoo deal and were not disappointed. Decor was unique and trendy, and location was very convenient walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and theater district. The lounge in the hotel is swankiest hotel bar I've seen, with red leather chairs, paintings on the walls, dimly lit lighting and a DJ on weekends. Our room was comfortable and we enjoyed the iHome so we could play our iPod. Only negative: Valet parking is pricey at $50/day. In the end, we got a good deal from TravelZoo, but it was a bit more than we thought with parking figured in.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: pace_ripley
Reviews.Content: The Sax Chicago is a good choice for business travelers. Rooms are clean and decently spacious, the shower is great, and the bed is comfortable. While it is not a new building, it is tastefully renovated and well appointed. The hotel bar is very cool and the location is excellent and close to attractions, bars and food. Getting to the Sax from the airport is a matter of a short walk and train ride. The only shortcomings are that the gym is slightly dark and has limited equipment and WiFi, while speedy, is not free. Overall, though, I was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Richiric
Reviews.Content: Can recommend this hotel. We got a really good deal through expedia hence the 5 out of 5. The hotel is centrally located at the Marina City development hence the strange towers (car parks/apartments in the photos). On some photo's it can look a bit uninviting with the towers but to be honest it's pretty cool. You don't travel to Chicago to be in the country side. Marina City is less than five minutes walk from Michigan Avenue and the Magnificent Mile. Friendly, helpful staff and a bar call Bin 36 specializing in wine and cheese just of the lobby, a bowling alley in the basement and another cool bar just of reception. Missing of the picture is a big flat screen TV, the rooms are nicely decorated, clean and of a fairly high standard. Complaints; glasses started disappearing after day one we started with six in the room and ended with one. The TV set itself to a high volume every time you turned it on (maybe good if you have gone deaf in the mean time), and I've learnt that it's maybe better to tip the maid a day earlier than you leave (there was a knock at the door at 9.45 the night before we left and again at 8am) if you want a lie in. All in all would gladly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Sax Chicago - February 2012”
Reviews.Author: KLH21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 3 nights in February 2012 as he was attneding a conference and overall had a good experience. The room was spacious for a city downtown hotel, the king bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very clean and very spacious and had a really nice firm shower, my only complaint about the bathroom was it could have used a table/shelve for storage, it only had a pedestal sink and a small glass shelf above the toilet - which personally I don't want to set anything right above a toilet, especially expensive creams, tooth brushes etc. But no big deal, there is plenty of places to put stuff in the room itself. The hotel has a really cool area/lounge by the business area where you can access the internet free of charge (wi-fi in the room is extra $). The hotel houses a cool lounge/club (Crimson) in the bottom, I loved the music/decor but the service was a little lacking and pretentious but to be expected I think, again no biggie. The hotel is right beside the House of Blues and close to lots of restaurants and bars and shopping. I am a big fan of the Thompson Hotel chain - they recently took over the SAX - it isn't necessarily as new/fresh as some of the other Thompson hotels I've stayed at but I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: laura v
Reviews.Content: The sax hotel is a beautiful historic hotel, located right near the river, with friendly service and an awesome Crimson Lounge. Pros: The service: staff were very friendly, prompt to help out and always someone around when you needed them. The morning coffee and computers in the lobby were extremely helpful Location: great location, close walk to all the sights and shopping Rooms: very cool setting, huge washrooms and comfortable beds Gym: the gym facilities were excellent, clean and had all the equipment I wanted cons: This hotel is old, and there are some definite maintenance issues. For instance, when we arrived our toilet would not flush properly, On the second day, the door handle fell of the inside of our door. These problems were fixed very quickly and the staff were apologetic, but I think a major renovation and repairs is needed to keep this hotel up to a four star standard.

Reviews.Title: “WORST BED EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineC919
Reviews.Content: Location, really good. Service, good. Decor, interesting. But, on the one thing a hotel MUST get right---BEDS---this hotel fails miserably. I stayed here twice, three nights each, in a month (for work...I had no choice but to return). Both times, I couldn't sleep AT ALL because of the lumpy and saggy beds. I seriously think that budget hotels have better beds. I actually slept on the floor the last night because the beds sucked so much. I'm a 30-year-old with no back problems or aches and pains on a regular basis, but every night and every morning, my back and hips were sore and I woke up many times during the night because I was uncomfortable. I wasn't just my room either. I had two different rooms in my differing stays and both beds were terrible, and two of my colleagues said their beds were also terrible. The center of the bed has some support running down in, so that's ok, but then each side dips down and sags. These beds must literally be 10 years old. I can't even imagine how disgusting they are under the sheets if they're old enough to be this saggy. And, the pillows, while fluffy and soft, also provide absolutely no support. I would never stay at this hotel again, despite the good location. NOT worth bad sleep...if you're sight-seeing you can't really enjoy it if you can't sleep. For work travelers, it's absolutely terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Travel_love7
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize that Hotel Sax is the old House of Blues Hotel. I like how it had a rock star personality with the Crimson Bar/decor while still maintaining the luxury look and feel. They let us check in early which was great! Plus their bell staff really went above and beyond to help us (especially Murphy!!) My friend fell on the sidewalk on Dearborn Street as we were leaving on Sunday. They helped us get ice, bandage, etc all while getting our car and packing us up. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Sax”
Reviews.Author: DebrahG
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Sax. Love the rooms, location and such a swanky feel to the lobby & bar. We take the Metra down from Harvard (we're Cheeseheads) and it's less than a mile walk from Ogilvie to the Sax. We stay here to go to great restaurants nearby and the Ford Theatre. The rooms are well-appointed and upscale and I love the thick towels & robes. The Sax never disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location, a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sax Hotel in February 2012. I booked it because of a price deal on Travelzoo, its location, and the reviews mostly being positive. The Sax was very pleasant, with fun and interesting decor and helpful pleasant staff. It is a beautiful hotel, really. We had a room on the 15th floor, overlooking the street. The view was great through the floor-to-ceiling windows that could be opened. The bed was really comfortable. The bathroom was quite large and had attractive tilework and fixtures. I asked for two extra pillows and some more towels, and the hotel provided them quickly. The room was clean and smelled nice. The hallways and amenities in the hotel were in good repair. The bathroom was stocked with some very nice lotion, a nice bar soap on the sink, and the shower/bath had squirt bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel. I liked the lotion a lot, and the bar soap as well. The shampoo/condition were OK but didn't seem to be of great quality. The use of the refillable pumps was fine for showering, but at one point I decided to have a bath and having to stand up periodically to reach the products was kind of inconvenient and potentially dangerous. The room was comfortable and seemed in good repair mostly. A few minor issues: I had to fix the toilet myself as the flusher handle was not attached to the mechanism and so the toilet wouldn't flush (easy fix and not worth calling down for maintenance, but shouldn't housekeeping have noticed when they were cleaning?). The room came stocked with only 2 bath towels. I had to ask for more towels, which were quickly provided, but next day after the room was cleaned we were back to two towels again. No washcloths provided at all on the first day. I assumed the hotel didn't provide washcloths, but the next day there were some. One other issue was that we could hear the people in the room next to ours. It was an adjoining room, and even normal talking levels could be heard far too well across the rooms. They need to do more soundproofing. I wasn't sure if it was just the adjoining doors that were the problem, or the walls as well. It was nice that on the other side of our room there was a staircase that wasn't much used. The second night we didn't have neighbors, so it was all very quiet. The fee to park the car was a bit higher ($52) than some of the other downtown hotels, but it was valet with in and out privileges. The cars were parked nearby (in the corncobs/Marina City) so getting the car when desired was fairly quick and easy. We did have one strange incident with the car. The morning after our arrival when we went downstairs, we found our car parked in front of the hotel. We hadn't asked for it or anything, and we weren't checking out until the next day. The valet wouldn't tell me why it was there, he just said "don't worry" when I asked why it was there. It was handy as we were able to get an item from the car that we had forgotten, but very mysterious! The room was stocked with a minibar tray and a refrigerated minibar. We used neither, but on our checkout, we were billed over $7 for cashews that we did not eat. The hotel desk person removed the charge without a hassle (still, I have seen this on many of the reviews making me wonder if they just throw minibar charges on the bills hoping people won't notice and will just pay it). The Crimson Lounge (bar inside the hotel) was nice, although expensive. The staff/service in the lounge was very attentive. We had the key lime martinis which were amazing! We found the music levels in the lounge pleasant if we went early in the evening. Later in the night it was too loud for us. They were replacing the desk chairs during our stay, so one day we had one chair and the next day we got a new one. The first chair was a bit battered and not very comfortable, but in-keeping with the hotel's funky decor. The second chair was much more comfortable - maybe not quite the funky style, but a nice modern style. We did also have a snakeskin chair that was fun although a bit noisy. The location of the Sax is perfect. It is right on the river and very easy to walk to a million fun places in the city. It is an easy walk to Michigan Ave, Millennium Park, and Navy Pier. There are all kinds of great theaters, bars, restaurants, parks, etc, within an easy walk. You might want a bus or a cab to some destinations that are a little bit further like the aquarium, planetarium, museum of science and industry, etc, but there is a lot within easy reach of your two feet. Loved the location of the Sax, the room, and the funky decor. The minor issues didn't really detract from my enjoyment of the stay there, but some people might be more bothered.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KitKatChicago
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here during a short weekend in Chicago. First night was at Hotel Felix, and while that hotel was OK, this hotel was MUCH better. Our room was very large with floor to ceiling windows, and while it was winter so I wouldn't take advantage of this but the hotel windows cracked open. This would be so great in the spring or summer. The hotel was very clean and modern. The hotel bar looked pretty cool too. The hotel is in a great location - close to several restaurants, bars, parking garage, etc.... I got this hotel on hotwire for $98 total with tax and tip. Great deal. We are hoping to stay at this hotel again next time we are downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cmh1986
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sax is in a great location--downtown right next to the House of Blues! Easy to get a taxi and just a short walk to Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park. Staff is very friendly and check-in was an EASY process. They even let us check-in a few hours early. The rooms look exactly like they do on the website. Big bathrooms! The only downside is the Wi-Fi is $15 for 24 hours. However, there are computers and printers available in the lobby. Overall, a GREAT experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: great location, great service, room towels left on chairs, empty coffee cups after cleaning staff finished. Terrific bell service, friendly. GREAT SIZE for room and bathroom. loved the refillable (eco friendly) shampoo, etc... a few stains on new carpet, chairs and furniture a little scuffed and nicked. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: hogdog3
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. Great location. Within walking distance to some of the most popular bars, restaurants, music venues in the city. Ok, I'll be honest..the decor was funky, but in a fun, weird way. The lobby, if that's what you call it, is not your traditional Grandiose welcoming entry, but hey, who really needs that? The room was good. Lots of space, large bathroom, everything you really need for a good nights sleep. After getting a feel for the slightly tacky wallpaper, I wasn't sure if this is the contemporary trend going on now, or just a room that needs updating. I guess a little of both... After taking care of some business in town, having a great dinner at Shaw's, the wife and I headed to the lounge to take advantage of the two free drink tickets we received upon check-in. Walking in to the lounge I couldn't help being amused by the decor. What is this? A bar, a bordello, WTF? I really loved it! Comfy chairs, couches, niches, alcoves to relax in. A highlight. All in all, it was cool tacky sheik. I'd recommend..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WalktheCIty
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Sax a few times and each time I have gotten a great rate on a good room. The beds are comfortable, the sheets are nice, and the room is clean and comfortable. The staff is pleasant and accommodating. The room service was prompt and the breakfast was average. Free coffee in the lobby in the morning was nice. In the shower they offer shower gel, shampoo and conditioner in large shared pump bottles, this I was not crazy about and I have not seen it in another hotel. All in all I would say if you can get it for a good price, this is a nice hotel, it looks just like the pictures, the decor is interesting and there is basically nothing wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “Tagging along for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Snorkler408
Reviews.Content: Background: Hubby had a business trip, so I tagged along. Lived in downtown Chicago for 3 years, so needless to say we were excited to be back! Pros: - Great location - next to the "corn cobs", House of Blues, downtown and the river - Ambiance - sexy decor, don't know how else to describe it. Take a look at the pics, lots of velvet, deep reds, etc. Actually I think someone described it as a Disney Haunted House vibe. Yes, a sexy Disney Haunted House vibe. - Staff - very friendly staff! I was sick and had some left over Soup Box (fast food soup place, do try the lobster bisque mixed with tomato soup if you're keen) and wanted to heat it up. I called room service and they delivered a microwave, bowl and spoon quickly and without a fee. Cons - View: website says ceiling to floor windows, but doesn't mention the wall dividers in the window (will post pictures) in our room - Small room: we had a room with one huge bed in it - and that's about it. There was a table along the wall at the foot of the bed, a flat screen, 2 chairs and 2 end tables, all squeezed into a small room. - Limited HD channels: we wanted to watch the Niners and Giants game from the privacy of our room and had to watch on a non-HD channel. If you plan to stay in doors and watch TV, call in advance to find out HD channels available. I know not a deal breaker, but it was the NFC championship game! - Mini bar charges! We got charged 1 M&M and 2 Miller Lite beers after the fact ($17). And we did not touch the bar. I called in and we got refunded (still waiting for confirmation) which was easy and fast, but I am wondering if they do that to all their customers, to see what they can get a way with? Conclusion Good for business trips. You're in and you're out. You've got a swanky bar in the lobby, Harry Caray's down the street, House of Blues at your finger tips and Caribou Coffee around the corner. If you are coffee and mocha lover, I do highly recommend Carbiou's mocha - dark chocolate! Each on comes with a Chocolate espresso bean. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Lisa8610
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Sax last week and spent Friday night at the hotel. The decor and atmosphere was fun and contemporay. The staff was outstanding and very accommodating. Fabian and a young lady from housekeeping were very personable and made our stay there special. We like to have stay vacation in the city and will choose the Sax next time. Our only complaint was the plumbing. The shower was great but the toliets need to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and the rooms have a complimentary martini shaker!”
Reviews.Author: starrynite2929
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the Sax. Beautifully hip hotel that isn't too stuffy just the right about of style to set it apart from other modern hotels in downtown chicago. You cannot beat the location nor the amenities. We received complimentary passes to the lounge downstairs which I later found out was one of the "hot clubs". It was fun none the less. Great stay all around and have recommended it to many friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 'unique' decor, interesting place”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleIllinois
Reviews.Content: Not certain what this hotel is trying to be, but maybe I'm just not hip enough. This boutique 15 story hotel has some interesting plush decor and public spaces that vary from Victorian to sort of 60's star trek, very good service and nice rooms. The location is right next to the House of Blues, and Harry Caray's restaurant and is near a host of other great restaurants. The 4th floor houses the meeting space with odd shaped areas that zig and zag and include a funky retro resting space. The hotel which tries very hard to be different, no doubt succeeds. Good enough for Snoop Dog and other artists who play next door at HOB.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overnight stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: wheretonext24
Reviews.Content: Nice location, rooms were clean and staff was very friendly. Enjoyed the music in the lobby bar on friday nights.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Haunted Mansion vibe going on?”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTommyboy
Reviews.Content: Thereâ€™s something oddly cool about the Sax Hotel in Chicago. Itâ€™s hard to put a finger on it. Is it the fancy lobby? Absolutely not. Quite frankly, the lobby isnâ€™t really fancy or a lobbyâ€¦ itâ€™s more like a hallway with Bin 36 on one end and a reception desk that doubles as a place to purchase fine crystal on the other. Is it the super friendly staff? Nope. Reception folks are nice, but about as nice as they are obligated to be. Donâ€™t expect a huge smile, a hug and a free room upgrade. This group - including valet - is all about efficiency, and they seem to do it well. Perhaps one of the reasons I like the Sax is because itâ€™s just different than most hotels. Itâ€™s got the Disney Haunted Mansion vibe going on. When the elevators open, or you key into your room, or visit the Crimson Lounge, you get the sense a fog machine is about to start up and Vincent Price is going to greet you. (As a side note, I swear the eyes on that womanâ€™s picture in the elevator move.) But none of this is meant in a negative way by any means. Actually, the mix of modern and somewhat darker motifs give this hotel a little character, which in my humble opinion is greatly missing in most cookie-cutter overnighters. As for the rooms, I have always found them to be clean and the late evenings quite. The dÃ©cor is trendy and unique. The shower/tub combo is a bit small, but suffices. The phone rings. The stereo, alarm clock and TV are all in good working order. The mini bar good to go. Comfy robes? Check. Beds and pillows are always subjective. You should note that when I hit a bed itâ€™s late, Iâ€™m beat, and Iâ€™m just glad itâ€™s not a holding cell. Could the rooms use a little upgrade at some point? Probably, but it shouldnâ€™t deter you. Perhaps the Saxâ€™s best characteristic is the location. No taxi needed to get to Ten Pin, Public House, Rockit Bar, Paris Club, Hub 51, Keefers, Trump Bar, Harry Careyâ€™s (very under-rated because of the name sake), and a thousand other fun places for great food and drinks. (Skip the cheesy tourist trap known in Chicago as the House of Blues unless you are attending a concert.) I love the location and if pressed could whip out another dozen or so â€œnot to be missedâ€� bars or restaurants without thinking. And, depending upon the event being hosted and the crowd, the environment at the Crimson Lounge in the Sax is a great place to meet people, dance, drink, and ultimately end the night. Guests at the hotel tend to be a little younger (under 40?)â€”and a little wilder looking than what youâ€™d find at the Embassy Suites down the street. Most are there to have a good time, not just crash for the night. While there are nicer hotel options, cheaper hotel options, and hotel options with more, well options (Spa? Pool? Full menu room service, etc.), in Chicago, the Sax is a unique boutique hotel with an interesting interior and a hard to beat location. Worthy of a visit whether you are by yourself, with a mate or a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “GF at time (Fiancee now) Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: JP S
Reviews.Content: We went in November 2010, the weather was a cold drissle that weekend. We walked to many places from there, including a liquor store to pay half the price for a .375 L Patron, which we drank and had a great time in the room one night. You get a bose radio that has a music connector also. The staff was really nice and the rooms were modern but functional. The price was great. Also i'm a car junkie and someone had a Ferrari outside for the night. Pretty sweet. anyways, the walkability to Michigan Avenue is a 7 in the winter and probably 8-8.4 in the summer. There was a bar, which i think was intended to be a club, that was empty, but it was awesome because we didn't have to pay $450 to get a table, and it was literally a club atmosphere, which too was sweet. It was right next to the House of Blues too.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Slowco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sax during a trip to Chicago a few weeks ago, and everything about the experience was amazing! I stayed in a King Suite, and the room was perfect. Everything from the front desk staff to the friendly members of the maintenance crew supplemented a great room. Fantastic customer service, amazing location, and a true feeling of "being taken care of" is what you will get when staying at the Sax. I would recommend to anyone visiting Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Bar and Location”
Reviews.Author: SpoiledVacationers
Reviews.Content: First of all, great location. Right next to House of Blues and near Harry Carray's steakhouse. Rooms were very elequent and modern with charming red-themed bar. Excellent customer service and had a pleasant stay. No complaints and got a good deal for $145 during early December business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its best”
Reviews.Author: jennifer0022
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of hotels in Chicago, trying different ones at different times, but we always come back to the Hotel Sax and after our last visit will make it our #1 hotel of choice in Chicago. This is because the customer service is excellent. From the staff at the desk to the staff assisting with cabs, parking, to the staff in the bar, every single employee made us feel welcome. Catherine Davids, the concierge, does a wonderful job in her position. She assisted us with our myriad of requests, restaurant selections, alternative activities because of weather (rain), play recommendations, tickets, etc. Sometimes you get more than you pay for, and in this case, we were treated like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Marcia H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sax last weekend with our friends to celebrate both of our 36th Wedding Anniversary. We have always enjoyed our stay there, and this time was no exception! The staff is exceptional!! We met Catherine Davids,the Chef Concierge, who was so helpful and friendly. She helped us select several restaurants to eat while we were there, and we found they were excellent choices!!! Thanks Sax staff for a wonderful weekend.....we will see you the next time we are in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service, affordable”
Reviews.Author: Joshua K
Reviews.Content: We found a good deal for the Hotel Sax on Expedia and enjoyed our stay completely. The location is outstanding, located just a couple of blocks from the Michigan Avenue shopping district. Although that convenience may be responsible for our sky-high December credit card bill. The staff was very friendly and more than happy to suggest restaurants and local favorites. One downside is the lack of free WiFi. The staff quickly recommended that we use the complimentary business center....and we did!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Chicago Getaway”
Reviews.Author: KristinOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: We had a great time! Everything was wonderful - nice room, good service, great location. Hoping to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: hazel0704
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here very much. It was my 1st time to Chicago and after doing a lot of research I picked this hotel because i was absolutely in love with the look and feel of it. I had amazing service from front desk to room service - perfection. The lounge in there is also a hot spot and nice to be able to walk home after a fun night out. Not to mention the House of blues and a bowling alley is right there too! The only thing i could imagine to make this hotel better is it be located right on Michigan Ave but for the great deal I got, i was incredibly happy. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!! Nice suite!”
Reviews.Author: viperdog8
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia and got a great rate. Upon check-in our room wasn't ready, so they upgraded us to a suite! It was gorgeous!! Living area and 2 bathrooms! If you are going to the House of Blues for a concert, this is the place to stay! Right across the parking lot. Tons of great restaurants within walking distance. Would definitely stay here again! Room was clean and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Jetkidd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we hoped for and more. Everything was made simple. Checked in as under 21's. They agreed to remove the minibar at a charge, and didn't even end up charging us. Realised last minute we had 2 single beds booked instead of a king. When we arrive they'd already made the arrangements to switch to a king. We asked for a top floor, we got the highest. We asked for a great view, we got the best. Can't fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No Coffee Pot!!”
Reviews.Author: ksp93
Reviews.Content: Booked through Travelzoo at a great rate. Arrived 10:30 a.m. Saturday morning and was able to check in immediately - great!!! Room was nice size and bathroom was huge - 705 - facing the House of Blues - no view. My biggest complaint....no coffee pot in the room! My husband suggested we just order a pot via room service...$10 per pot, 18% gratuity and a $3 delivery charge - Really???? We were able to keep our luggage at the hotel Sunday while we shopped and caught the 5:15 p.m. train home. I would stay here again if the rate was good - sure hope they rethink that coffee pot thing - lol!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Very good rooms”
Reviews.Author: PShermanATL
Reviews.Content: Had a king suite on a very high floor. Great view, great room. Had a nice gym that was never crowded. Restaurant (Bin 36) was a great dining option, and room service breakfast was very good. The bathroom was an excellent feature as it was huge! Loved my stay here and will definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: coharahawk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend trip. I booked the hotel via Priceline and got a great price. We were put on one of the lower floors. The room was small, but nicely appointed and clean. The bathroom was small with only a stand-up shower (no tub). The staff seemed friendly. As mentioned by previous reviewers, there were some noise issues, even with people talking in the hallway at a reasonable volume. The location was great, in particular, it is in close vicinity to the red, blue, and brown cta lines. I would stay here again. Based on previous reviewers and the website, I wonder if certain rooms are reserved for Priceline reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: MzShowStoppa
Reviews.Content: My friends and I found a great deal for Sax on Travelzoo. It was within walking distance of major shopping as well as restaurants. Directly across from House Of Blues. The attached restaurant Bin 36 was an added bonus, with a great menu as well as friendly staff. The Sax's beds were soft (doubles were closer to full size instead of queen) and the bathroom was HUGE! It appears as if many of the rooms were being remodeled (did have to complain of early am noise due to this), but not a big enough deal for the value we received. The front desk staff were friendly and accomodating while the bellmen were very friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Amandamluz
Reviews.Content: The Sax Hotel is a great option in Chicago! We would do everything walking, as for shopping is a great deal, since you can go back and leave all your bags in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “not 4 star but hip”
Reviews.Author: USVItravel
Reviews.Content: the HOTEL SAX is not a 4 star property IMHO, but it is hip and fun and clean... with friendly staff, good foodstuffs, superior location, comfortable beds... easy to like, especially if you enjoy the (in-house) HOUSE OF BLUES.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Trip”
Reviews.Author: rinnacakes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sax for a weekend getaway. Close to harry Carey's and other restaurants. Room service for breakfast was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a decent hotel in a great location of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: kimjim
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel a 3 1/2. It is clean and comfortable, but a bit dark. Some features that I found odd were: the closet is behind a curtain, there is a safe in the wall, and the bathtub is a square not fit for a bath. The bathroom is large, but there is not enough counter space for a larger toiletry bag. Internet is about $11 for 24 hours. The hotel has a small fitness center with one bike, several treadmills, and several elliptical machines. There are also weights, mats, and exercise balls. I paid $159 for a weeknight, which is a great deal for this type of room in Chicago. It is conveniently located just a few blocks from the Clark/Lake stop on the Blue line (CTA) from O'Hare, next to the House of Blues, and blocks from many great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Outside looks bland but interior is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: I have passed this hotel many times while in Chicago and on the outside it does not look appealing, however on the inside it is fantastic. The staff is excellent and the location was ideal for the clients I was in town seeing. My only complaint is the desk chair is not condusive to sitting for long periods of time doing work. Other than that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WGBHStudioTours
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sax Hotel for business in Chicago. Location is perfect. Price is right. Nice staff! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not Good At All”
Reviews.Author: mudspoke
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a more disappointing hotel while attending a professional conference. First and foremost, the toilet "ran" all the time. Multiple attempts to cease the noise, including lifting the back off of the toilet to investigate the hardware inside, did little to curtail the incessant noise. I also could not connect to the internet because the hard-wire connector was not plugged into the wall, and the connector plate was behind the headboard, which was affixed to the wall, prohibiting access to it. Although wireless was an option, the signal strength was too weak to be effective in the room. Every time I turned on the TV, the volume was extremely LOUD, even though I would turn it off at a much lower volume; attempts to change this apparent default via the TV and the remote were fruitless. Although the "hotel services" book listed prices for items in a mini-bar, there was no such item in the room. Since there were no ice machines nor vending machines anywhere to be found, I either had to visit a restaurant or drink water out of the tap for fluids. The walls also were so thin that I felt I was in the middle of the argument between the couple next door at 2:00 in the morning. Finally, the room thermostat seemed to be oblivious to any changes I made, as it was always extremely warm in my room. To be blunt, the location of this hotel is great. It is basically next door to Harry Carey's and across the street from the House of Blues, two venues which I love in Chicago, but I will not stay here as long as it is owned by Thompson. There are just too many other places to stay in Chicago to take a chance on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous modern boutique hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: DebrahG
Reviews.Content: Love the Sax. Got a deal to stay there (maybe Travel Zoo) and want to go back. It's a great little boutique hotel located right in the heart of Chi-town. Well-appointed modern rooms and super-quiet! Easy to walk to restaurants, MI Avenue shopping and our room had some great views of the river. Staff was friendly & the cocktail hour was quite nice. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “good been lacking a few things”
Reviews.Author: intsik
Reviews.Content: the sax is a pretty, funky hotel near the river. location super ideal for any point in town. since it straddles the river pretty much. the common areas are nice, hung out at the bar and it was funky, but not overly noisy. service was polite and efficient. the room was spacious and solidly decorated. what i found a bit annoying were little things frankly. i was looking for pen and paper, cotton swabs, little stuff like that that wasnt around. in the bathroom, there was one bar of soap, so i was taking it between the sink and the shower. i thought housekeeping just forgot to put one, but i stayed there three days and no one gave me another bar. (not that i asked either, but still.) got a pretty decent deal on priceline, but if i paid regular rates, would not have been super happy. tiny details were lacking. and please please for a "modern" hotel, internet for the love of god should be free.

Reviews.Title: “If the walls weren't so thin this place would have been great.”
Reviews.Author: webgrl02
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms were quite nice. The decor was very modern. I had a king suite with a snake skin chair. It was billed as a 4 star hotel but was more of a 3.5 as other reviewers have mentioned. The location was good. Closer to the loop than the Miracle Mile. It is very close to the bar scene in Chicago which is good and bad. I was there Halloween weekend and I think some people had gotten a room there to avoid having to drive home. At around 3 am the two nights I was there I could hear people talking in the adjacent rooms. Not screaming but talking fairly loud. I have stayed in much cheaper hotels that were quieter than this. I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good position and service”
Reviews.Author: winecaddie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 days while attending a conference in the Trump Towers. The hotel's location was good, the rooms great and staff service excellent. Great value for money. Pity the WiFi Internet access is quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay. More like 3.5 star but good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cotik
Reviews.Content: Since I was concerned about the bedbug reviews before my stay, I feel like I have to write my own review. I am happy to report that I did not have any trouble during my stay. The Sax does look like an older hotel (cracks on bathroom vanity/stains on curtains/peeling wallpaper etc.) but the room was clean enough to be comfortable. Like the other reviewers said, the mattress does feel old (a bit sagging) but I had a good night sleep anyway. If this hotel was 3 star, I would give "excellent" for its uniqueness and overall quality, but when compared to other 4 star hotels it lacks on many levels. However, I should note that for the price I paid (through the bidding site, my rate was more like 3 star hotel) I was a happy customer. The biggest plus was the customer service. Very friendly and upon check-in he gave me a decent room (2 beds with good view) despite my rate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Decor but Front Desk lacks hospitality”
Reviews.Author: SuiteTimes
Reviews.Content: The decor in the hotel is beautiful. The room is small yet functional and includes a mounted flat screen television. The bathroom is large and well-lit with a "rain" shower head. I received plenty of towels and the amenities were well stocked. On another note, the front desk employees were very sterile and not very cordial (almost dismissive). They didn't make me feel comfortable when I entered the hotel or when I asked questions about my bill. This hotel would receive a higher rating ( at least a 4) if the hotel front stafff were more cordial (at least smile and be attentive).

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CrispyRice
Reviews.Content: Definitely not your run-of-the-mill hotel. It's right next to the House of Blues and carries over that bluesy / southern feeling. I kept expecting to see Elvis come around the corner. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The location is great. The bed was wonderful. I flew in in the morning and arrived about 9:00 am, just planning to drop my luggage with the desk, but they had a room to give me already. Excellent! The ceilings were very high, which gave you a great feeling of space. There were robes in the room, and the towels were nice and thick. My few cons, which aren't deal breakers, but are good to know. $15 per 24 hours of internet in the room, although it was free in the business lounge. The room was a little on the tattered side - a broken switch plate, peeling wallpaper, some trash from the previous occupant that fell out from behind the desk. In my bath, there was nowhere to hang a towel where you could reach it from the shower, and there was no space on the vanity to put anything. Nothing huge, but not quite perfect either. I did get this hotel through a bidding site, so considering what I paid, it was great deal and I wouldn't be at all upset if the Sax came up again for me.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky in a good way:one of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxduo
Reviews.Content: We arrived 3 hours prior to check in time. Nonetheless, we got exactly the room which we had requested at time of reservation- high floor and river view. Within minutes we were unpacking in the room. That is good service from the start. We were pleased to find a spacious, king bed room. It had obviously been renovated recently- new carpets and paint. Comfy, fluffy robes in the closet. The decor is best described as amusing whimsey but not over the top. Certainly not your typical chain bland decor. The king bed deserves special praise:high quality comfort with likewise linens. The floor was quiet- good sound proofing. Some reviews describe the Sax as a noisy hotel. Our room (1203) was a good distance away from the elevators Not one disturbance in a whole week. Our conference rate included complimentary WiFi in the room. Although repetitive- it is truly an ideal location. Highly revommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Cleanliness and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: 34515Chris
Reviews.Content: From the moment we exited our taxi, we were greeted with a smiling face and a kind greeting. in to the lobby where the kindness continued. The location of th eSax is Great. Th hotel is clean and quiet. The hotel bar is a great place to relax and have a cocktail. The bar gets quite lively in to the evening - which we enjoyed. Chicago is full of Great places to stay. We will definitely return to The Sax Hotel again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, modern funky hotel with STYLE”
Reviews.Author: mkellis
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is amazing - modern, funky, original and fun - this hotel has spunk! GREAT location - so much so that I bought a 3 day subway/el pass before I arrived and only used it twice - you could walk to most things - even me, whose legs don't work very well/pain etc. The rooms were boutique style, bed so comfortable, bathroom good also. I asked for a river view and boy did I get it! Awesome. There is a bar called crimson lounge - felt like an a lister going in (you get free entrance if you stay here) There is also a restaurant (didn't try it) and posh 10 pin bowling alley. The hotel is part of marina city next to the corn on the cob buildings. Service really good, especially concierge. The rack rate of the hotel is expensive, but I got a really good deal through a website here in the UK - just look around for deals, including the obvious expedia etc The hotel was a real experience and I felt like it was VERY exclusive too (but not at ALL stuffy). Go and check out the dueling piano bar - Howl at the moon round the corner, and make sure you have a burger at billy goat tavern - the best burger i have had! SO much to do in Chicago, Willis Tower, gangster bus tour ( a laugh and learning about the mafia too), the architecture, Grant and Milllenium Park, the Bean (aka Cloud Gate) etc etc It was New York, but now Chicago is my favorite US city, and this hotel helped clinch it. Would HIGHLY recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: SpringTimeFun
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the great service we had at the SAX Hotel. From the efficiency of the front desk to the helpfulness of the Concierge... Fabio was GREAT!! He always made sure to greet us and was always helpful with what ever our need was.. From shopping tips to a recommendation for a great breakfast!! Thanks!! We will definitely stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, decent price”
Reviews.Author: lynx74
Reviews.Content: For the money - a nice value in the heart of the loop - and despite being steps from the House of Blues - and the disco hotel bar - the rooms are exceedingly quiet. Nothing at the hotel will really blow you away style or service wise - and the bath products are utilitarian at best - you can't beat the location/price mix at the Sax.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sax chicago”
Reviews.Author: tunisbridal
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for a business trip. Loved the hotel. Very unique. Beds very comfy and clean. This is my second stay for this hotel. NO free wi-fi however.

Reviews.Title: “Sax Chicago - A 4-Star Hotel Better Than Most 5-Star Hotels”
Reviews.Author: JB D
Reviews.Content: Although officially rated a 4-star hotel online, Sax Chicago is more happening than most 5-star hotels at which I've stayed. It's elegant without being ostentatious, exceedingly clean and comfortable, and has all the amenities. The staff is courteous, genuinely warm, helpful, and professional. And the coffee and tea they serve complimentary in the lobby every morning is as good as it gets, rivaling what you'd expect from Chicago's top coffee houses. The hotel's Crimson Lounge is hip and contemporary, featuring DJs, live jazz, an excellent selection of spirits, wine, beer, and appetizers, and some of the most beautiful people in Chicago. The adjoining Bin 36 Restaurant/Wine and Cheese Bar is amongst the best of its kind in the country. And if that's not enough, Chicago's world famous House of Blues is right next door! I travel to the Windy City several times per year and I always stay at the Sax. Ideally located (walking distance to everything), the hotel has become a home away from home for me. I give it my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here.”
Reviews.Author: mollygirl1313
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with girlfriends in April. Staff was very helpful with unloading and parking, giving us directions, etc. The rooms were gorgeous. Funky and unique. A perfect place for 8 girls in their early 20's...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: fonsqatar
Reviews.Content: I was a bit adamant after reading some no very positive reviews but I have to say I was impressed with the hotel from the second I stepped in. The checking in was fast and pleasant and I was able to go to my room way before the advertised check in time. The room was beautiful. I must admit the deco may not be to everybody's taste but it did it for me. The bathroom was nice and spacious and I loved the chequered tiles. The location is in the heart of the city, literally minutes from the Loop and Michigan avenue and there are lots of bars and restaurants just a few steps away on Hubbard st, which also boosts a pretty good night life. Overall a very pleasant experience and wouldn't hesitate to return to the Sax when I'm in Chicago next.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and unique!”
Reviews.Author: mcglynndon
Reviews.Content: We stayed after receiving this hotel via priceline. A great unique property with highly attentive staff! They bent over backwards to help us in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Well-Appointed & in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: jsantivanez
Reviews.Content: Great place & unbeatable location. Harry Caray's right next door, House of Blues across the street, walking distance to everything. Great in-room amenities and fantastic vibes from the lounge areas.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: Medalert
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference being held at another hotel because staying at the Sax Hotel has been excellent in the past. I was not disappointed. Even though I arrived early, Ana was able to check me in..no problem. The room was on the 16th floor with a great Chicago river view...Water Taxi's, tour boats, kyakers. Could sorta tell how cool or warm or wet it was from looking out the window at walkers below. River Walk is close to Hotel so able to walk along the river with no vehicle noise and nice. Halls, lobby all clean, neat. Room was very clean and quiet even though the lobby always seemed busy. Room not too cold/hot, Don't use the honor's bar but is available. Staff professional and friendly. I do recall some names but didn't get all the names: Samantha and Catherine (both very helpful concierges), Constantine (bellman...I think..), Rico and Wayne (doormen...), AJ (morning wake up calls were appreciated and got the weather report, too). To all the Sax Hotel staff who made my stay enjoyable, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Strange rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ldruken
Reviews.Content: Overall I can't complain about this hotel. The room was a bit small and the sink was in the room not in the bathroom which I didn't like. The bed was very comfie and the tv was large. There are great restaurants downstairs for all prices and tastes. This is about five minutes from millennium park and very close to the theatre district and the magnificent mile. Great location and good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: deannamkron
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff (with the exception of the valet over the phone) and trendy decor. Convent android application to communicate with staff. Overall an average quality hotel with modern decor. Very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome spot in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MissMinnesota
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! I went with my boyfriend and we stayed one night. The room was really nice, very elegant and clean. They have valet service so you don't have to deal with parking downtown. And the location is unbeatable. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It was a treat to crawl into their bed at night!

Reviews.Title: “Super cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: NycBlessed
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great vibe and is located in a great, convenient part of the city. The location is walking distance to everything. The price was also very reasonable. The concierge was helpful and gave some good recommendations on where to go to dinner, etc. The rooms were large and spotless with a very cool contemporary design. The bathroom was exceptionally roomy for a hotel. An added plus was the lounge downstairs. It was always fun and a 10 second commute to your room if you had a couple of drinks. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating..... Staff was excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Greg W
Reviews.Content: Sax Chicago is the new choice for my family when visiting Chicago. On a whim my wife and I decided to take our 16 month old daughter to the zoo. We heard from a friend to try Sax. We did and could not have been more impressed. Before we arrived I called Samantha at the Concierge desk and asked her to make reservations for us at our favorite restaurant. She did so and very quickly, I might add. I received a confirmation email in about twenty minutes. Next I talked with Aisha at the front desk to see if there was a way to get a fridge and microwave. Done and Done. When we arrived, the bellman and the valet were very gracious and helpful in getting our luggage together and brought to the room. The room was very nice. Clean, comfortable, roomy. We were able to set up a play area for our daughter and she loved looking out the window. I will recommend Sax Chicago to anyone and we will definitely be staying again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised...”
Reviews.Author: PASL23
Reviews.Content: A solid property, room was in good shape, nicely appointed and a good size. Good location downtown and a short walk to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Unless House of Blues is in your cards - the hotel is a WILDCARD”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJayBird
Reviews.Content: Although very cool with hip decor - I could envision having a party here, but not a long weekend with my girlfriend. UNLESS, i was in a band playing at the House of Blues then it would be perfect. I can smell the place now just thinking of it - if youve been there, you know the smell - just kind of an odd place - not bad, but certainly not my taste

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Sax”
Reviews.Author: Lindo
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about this hotel. Would start off by saying that we got an Expedia package deal and our room was only 145CAD a night. I believe the regular price is a lot higher. Room was large, clean and funky. Staff were helpful. Excellent central location with a lot of great restaurants close by. Would stay here again - if the price was right ;)

Reviews.Title: “Cool vibe - Murphy was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JKeegs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sax Chicago for two nights during a cross country road trip. The service here was impeccable. Murphy (our hero) found somewhere for us to park our car plus trailer monstrosity (one of our party was moving to Portland, thus the road trip), checked on it daily and was very helpful all around. The rooms were very cool looking - the whole hotel has a dark, rocker feel to it. The beds were comfortable, the hotel was clean and the location was great. It was a short cab ride anywhere we wanted to go, near the El and about a 25 minute walk to Navy Pier. Also - huge hotel bar!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sax Chicago”
Reviews.Author: chevettejill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we were going to a show at the House of Blues. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was very attentive and helpful. We were a little scared about driving through Chicago but this hotel was very easy to get to. We had a great time and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated VERY Well!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomahawk06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Sax. This was my first stay in Chicago. One of the nicest aspects was the proximity to the the EL from O'Hare Airport. The stop was just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Upon making an on-line reservation (which originally was a double queen superior room), I requested to get a room that was far away from the elevator and would be high enough to be able see the Chicago River. They said they would do what they could. When I arrived, I found that they had upgraded me to a deluxe room with a King on the 14th floor that had an absolutely great view! I entered a room that was spotlessly clean with everything in perfect working order. The room was great an included one of the largest bathrooms I've seen in hotel room. We found that the location of the hotel (one block north of the River and a couple blocks west of the Miracle Mile) was perfect. It was close to everything and we had a wonderful visit to Chicago. My one, and only, criticism of this hotel is that getting my morning coffee was inconvenient. There is no in-room coffee maker though they do provide (excellent) coffee in the lobby. Unfortunately, they stop providing coffee at 8:00 AM - which is tough for those who are on vacation. If they had kept the coffee going until 9:00, I would have had a perfect stay. I'd give this hotel a solid 4 and 1/2 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: cranberry28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just so comfy, classy and the rooms were just so outstanding, with a bar at your expense. very nice. the view of the chicago loop was a plus

Reviews.Title: “great location in River North”
Reviews.Author: TrailBiker_MD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4th July this past year and it was a great location to get to everywhere in Downtown Chicago. Can walk to most restaurants, subway, the river, the tours, millenium park etc. The hotel was a bit too psychedelic for my taste and can give you a migraine, but couldnt beat the location. The bathroom shower had no door, and the shower had a leak, so the entire bathroom got wet when you took a shower. The rooms were very dark as if they were trying to get the same atmosphere at the W chain, but were unsuccessful. Room was also a nice size and there was a safe in the room which is always nice to have. The staff were very helpful. The room was quite even tho the lounge was always bustling. Its also right next to the House of Blues and the Maritime Towers so the place was always happening. The morning we left, we just walked out with our bags and a cab was there to take us to the airport. I would recommend this place if you want to be at the heart of everything in downtown chicago

Reviews.Title: “No way... never again”
Reviews.Author: Karenna_11
Reviews.Content: We didn't enjoy this space. The downstairs restaurant staff were rude, the view was poor and the walkway next to the hotel smelled like urine. A local cafe known as 'Dick's Last Resort' was recommended and it was a dump. Never again! Odd for a hotel under a Thompson banner - the Toronto one is so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Average disguised by chic”
Reviews.Author: Kaerolin
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a unique style. Contemporary chic meets the 1970s basement rec room. I think because of the style it's less obvious that it's so average. My experience: If walking to the location, the front entrance is not particularly obvious. Just a note. When I entered my room, there was an envelope on the desk addressed to perhaps a different guest in a different room. No big sea -l when I called down to the desk someone came up to get it right away. Things that make it a mediocre hotel are - lack of coffee machine, lack of towels (I had 2 towels and 2 cloths, and only got the additional 2 hand towels on my second day), and lack of furniture. The bed appears comfortable but is lumpy and squeaky. For some reason the hallways are dark, damp, and over-air conditioned. Add the smell of cologne and I'd feel like I was in a clothing store for teens only. My room was also way too air-conditioned and took a number of hours set at 80 to heat up to just normal room temperature. I grabbed a snack from the honour bar and noticed afterward the best by date of 03/11 (my stay was 08/11). It won't kill me but for $7, a luxury or high end hotel would have been on top of that. Also amusing about the honour bar, I had a different selection in it this morning before I left than the one I had when I got back later in the day. I also feel like this hotel is minimally staffed. I barely ever see anyone, at concierge, front desk or otherwise. It's not that the hotel isn't functioning for lack of staff, just in general, I never really see anyone to just ask a casual question of. Last thing, beware the internet... $15/day is totally nuts. My overall opinion is that it's adequate. It was quiet (on the back facing kinzie). It was clean. It was centrally located. But I wouldn't stay here again. Of all the hotels Chicago has to offer, there are others that would be more comfortable and offer more luxury at the same prices.

Reviews.Title: “Can't argue with the location”
Reviews.Author: RIKKASDAD
Reviews.Content: Location is terrific--right next to the House of BLues, a couple fo blocks from the State-Lake L stop and others. Near great restaurants. Room was clean, elevators were fast, and in spite of all the parties it was pretty quiet. In the evening, the lobby was LOUD, but my room at least was quiet. In two full days, I never got the feeling that the staff cared whether I was there or not. Busienss center was acouple of computers that were not connected to a functioning printer. But still a good value.

Reviews.Title: “great room , great rate , friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lannons
Reviews.Content: we were in room 722 for the 20th,21st , 22nd. good size room . awesome breakfast -roomservice , 50' from the house of blues . great value for the money . staff were all great . there was something dripping down the face o the bathroom door - yellow( is it still there??? ) . tooth paste splatter on bathroom wall , yellow stain of something on ceiling above tub & a white blob of something on the back of the cold water tap - we saw it in the reflection of the mirror . the room service guy asked if everything was ok , we told hime about door drip stuff . when we checked out a day & 1/2 later , it was still there . not a huge issue , yet something that can occure . we should have told front desk but were having toooo much fun & tooo excited & wayyy to exhausted about/from our 1st trip to chicago . so , we will go back because everything elese was above standard !!!!! we expect our next stay to exceed this one !!!!! it is worth going & right down town . thanks to all the staff .!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sax! What a jewel! Heart of Downtown Chicago, next to the House of Blues”
Reviews.Author: barbi-boeger
Reviews.Content: We flew into Omaha, drove to a fam reunion in Iowa, then drove thru to Illinois, and spent 2 awesome days in Chicago. I did the "Ya don't know the name , til ya book" and we ended up at the Sax! It was a boutiquey hotel, with unusual, edgy, ambiance. Loved the trendy, upscale decor. Loved the bar, the restaurant was a Wine Bar with a Cheese Bar. We loved the food, and loved our stay. The parking was pricey, but I would definately book again, more directly this time. Staff was unusually friendly for such a nice place, and the Concierge, she helped us book, the Segway tour, which was an awesome highlight, especially for my college 19 year old. We saw the Bean, awesome! We did the waterway tour, and the Art Museum was off the hook. Van Gogh's self portrait, Monet's, I recognized so many pictures, and I am not an art buff. My daughter really enjoyed the whole time, 2 days in Chicago. We highly recc the Sax, oh and the House of Blues, which is 50 steps out the front door. Chicago was the highlight of our trip, who'da thunk!?

Reviews.Title: “Good but Could be better”
Reviews.Author: errikinky
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights. I don't like the decoration, but that's personal preference. The location is good and the rooms are big enough and nice. Room service quality was not what i expected but the hotel is good value for money. Compared to the Thomson in NYC it's not as good. The staff were very nice and always helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not for picky people”
Reviews.Author: diamond_6irl
Reviews.Content: I found very interesting to read such good reviews and such good titles, such as "spectacular", "outstanding","beautiful"... What it works for you might not work for me. What you find outstanding I might find it random and so on. It really depends on the type of hotels you're used to, your perception on things and how picky you are. I've been to such amazing hotels all over the world with such quality and professionalism by the staff that honesty when I read people think this hotel is "amazing" gives me a jaw drop.Â First of all, I'm a frequent traveler to the wonderful city of Chicago since is my bf home town. We like to always try different hotels in the city. This time we tried Sax Hotel. We stayed 7 nights in room 1019. Got Studio King Room.Â This room offers king bed, sofa bed, two flat tv (one for living room area and one for bed area) desk, snacks & beverages, small closet for such a big room, floor to ceiling windows, good sized bathroom, vanity mirror, hair dryer, two sinks, decent sized tub.Â The sleeping quality was ok. But bed was too soft and pillows were almost flat, which don't give full support to your neck. No free internet provided. As an additional detail i want to share, one night my bf complained that he felt a bug bite in his arm. We thought it was a mosquito bite, but the next day I woke up with 5 nasty bites all over. Bedbugs? A Spider? Mosquitoes?? you be the judge. All I know is no so called 4 star hotels should even have mosquitos in their rooms. Other thing that I noticed is they don't really clean well. Saw lots of dust in mirrors and tables. Im a cleaning freak since im allergic to dust, so you can imagine the scene. Can't believe they have stains on the main lobby carpets. An insult to guests in my opinion. Decor in general is pretty random and even starting to look dated. Not sure whyÂ people think is "beautiful". Funky old couches, red carpets (a big indicator of old-fashioned hotels) poor lightning, weird painting in elevators and lounge, it almost feels they came out of a Harry Potter movie and the people in the painting will move. Weird front desk glass cabinet, cheap Christmas lights in window. Definitely not a good taste decor. Parking cost is ridiculous! 52 bucks for 24 hrs, are you kidding me? Room service is expensive too. Almost 70 bucks Â for a random breakfast for 2. Definitely not worth it. If you add those extra expenses to the room bill you can easily get a nice room in Trump Tower.Â However, the good thing about this hotel is the fabulous location. But as I said, you can get a better hotel in the same area for the same price or a little bit more. Hotel 71 or the Wit are good choices. All these little details such as price, service, cleanliness, and decor make a big difference between poor, good and great hotels.Â

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!!!”
Reviews.Author: ericsf
Reviews.Content: Had an absolutely spectacular stay at the Hotel Sax. The staff was super friendly and very attentive. Loved my room. Had a great view of the river and lots of sunlight. The bed had very nice linens and great pillows!! Overall I was highly impressed and definitely want to stay here again next time I am in Chicago. Only downside I can find is that parking is extremely expensive at 52 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “suprised”
Reviews.Author: vdcplease
Reviews.Content: having just joined tripadvisor i am now catching up from all the hotels i have stayed at this year, both on business and pleasure. I was SUPER shocked to see the Sax Chicago not in the top 5, 10, or even 20 hotels in Chicago! This hotel is seriously fabulous and definitely underrated on tripadvisor. I managed to get an amazing deal on expedia for this hotel and i had a great room with views to the river/channel/whatever its called. The room was spacious and the bed super comfortable. Most importantly though, the located was second to none. I loved how u could sign your meals at nearby restaurants back to the hotel. Very clever to increase the dining facilities offered to guests. i would 100% stay here next time i return to ORD.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Beautiful and great service”
Reviews.Author: red_9960
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sax for our anniversary and I was impressed with both the hotel and staff. After a very hot morning sightseeing we walked into the hotel entrance only to find a table with ice cold lemon infused water set up for guests. How thoughtful! I then overheard a manager checking to ensure that it was not too hot in the lobby. Our housekeeper doubled up on towels as the heat was such that people were taking extra showers. The Concierge went out of her way for us. The decor in the rooms is not typical and was very elegant. The fourth floor is georgeous. Conveniently located. I really enjoyed my stay and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Scubamama4
Reviews.Content: Realizing that the average person staying at this hotel may know what to do, it was confusing to us. There was a concert at the House of Blues next door, so right from the start, we didn't know where to go for the valet parking. The parking is EXTREMELY overpriced, $52/night. Are you supposed to tip everyone who helps you? I felt a little like fresh roadkill rather than someone trying to check into a hotel. When we got to the rooms, it was a little disappointing. Everything looked like it came straight from a 70's yardsale..not belonging in a 4 star hotel. Honestly, I've seen MUCH nicer Holiday Inn Express rooms...at least we would have had a little fridge to put some drinks/snacks in. No coffee maker! That was a huge lacking element...guess they want to do that for you too. Overpriced. Not worth it at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Absolutely be Back!”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreHokie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple went to Chicago for the Taste of Chicago event. We stayed at the Sax from July 1 - 4 and loved it! The atmosphere and decor was total rock star. We arrived very early on 7/1 but were able to check into our room immediately around 10:30 am. We flew in from Baltimore and took the subway from the airport to the hotel. The subway stop was only two blocks from the hotel and a heck of a lot cheaper than a taxi. We purchased a 3-day subway pass and it was totally worth it! The location is perfect for heading north to do some shopping on the Magnificent Mile or heading south to the riverwalk and Millennium Park and other attractions. The rooms were on the smallish side but really no complaints - we didn't spend too much time in them except to sleep. There is so much to do in Chicago we barely made a dent. The House of Blues is right out front of the hotel. We went there one night and saw a pretty decent band. We never went into the lounge/bar in the hotel itself. It wasn't quite our scene but other folks might like it. The next time I am in Chicago I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “This Sax Isn't as Sweet as it Sounds”
Reviews.Author: Kauf
Reviews.Content: The Sax is one of those "trying hard to be hip" hotels that just doesn't quite make it...especially for the money. The hotel itself is OK, the rooms are a bit cooler than normal but the amenities are off. No restaurant (except next door); coffee serves ends promptly at 8am; I've tried to get in to the House of Blues next door with my free Sax pass -- closed due to private parties both times; the hallways are a bit worn and musty, the showers/bathrooms are pretty crude. These off notes make for an OK stay that's a bit out of tune with all the hype around the Thompson chain. Not bad, just not that great. For a better value and a better job at pulling cool off try the Hotel Palomar. The Kimpton hotel group does a lot better than Thompson when it comes to striking that sweet note you are looking for at an upscale property like this.

Reviews.Title: “Hip but fun even for old folks!”
Reviews.Author: JunebugTexas
Reviews.Content: The Sax was an ideal hotel to stay in. Close to mass transit, restaurants, 7-Elevens, Mag Mile, and the river. The interior decor is very "hip" and would appeal to younger folk, but we enjoyed it too. The desk and concierge people were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. We used them to book restaurants and boat trips since we were there on the busy Chicago Marathon weekend. Tip: As previous posters have stated, the waters and snack tray will definitely cost you. Another tip: good breakfast next door. A little expensive, but you pay for location.

Reviews.Title: “Aesthetically pleasing decor, friendly staff, and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: LCM07
Reviews.Content: A really beautifully decorated hotel with friendly staff who were extremely helpful and friendly. Great location in the heart of the city--near the Mag Mile and great surrounding shops especially the 5-story art and antique gallery. We didn't really spend much time in the room, but it was nice, relatively spacious with a great bathroom and a mixture of interesting furnishings. My only complain (as an allergy sufferer) was that there was a layer of dust covering everything in the room. My friend and I decided that complaining would probably not be a good idea, so I found a drugstore bought allergy meds and dusted the room myself. After day 1, I was fine. The Crimson Lounge was my favorite. I could have hung out there for days but could have gone without the rave-techno music on Saturday night, which, in my opinion did not mesh well with the baroque furnishings and overall antiquarian aura. It was my first time in Chicago, what a beautiful city with so much to offer! I'm assuming the room rate was standard, but did seem a little pricey. Regardless, it was a great trip and I highly recommend the Sax Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: pooscorner
Reviews.Content: I booked a couple days worth of business meetings at the Sax, and it was one of the best places we have stayed. The hotel is very beautiful and clean. The meeting rooms were set up perfectly for our needs, and the staff is very attentive. We were especially impressed by the quality of the food served in the meeting rooms, delicious! Also, they do have a lovely lounge, and the location is just right in the heart of downtown, right on the river. Plenty of things to do on foot. We had about 45 in our group and no complaints. Yes, it is expensive to park downtown, so most of us just taxi'd into the city and Midway is a pretty close airport. We also walked to the CTA subway line and went to a Cubs game - just a 4 block walk from the Sax. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “I love Chicago and Hotel Sax!!”
Reviews.Author: MLMC
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel from the start, once we managed to discern that the sleek glass case check-in desk with friendly staff was to the right of their Crimson Lounge! We really liked the very trendy decor throughout the hotel and our room (a king studio on the 10th floor at the back of the building) featured high ceilings with a floor-to-celing and wall-to-wall bedroom window. Both the bedroom and bathroom were spacious, modern, comfortable and clean (one thing to note is that our bathroom had an abbreviated bathtub but we didn't mind since we're not bath people). The business centre on the 4th floor is a bit tricky to find due to low lighting, no signage and being tucked away in the cavernous lounge space but we appreciated that it was quiet there and free to hotel guests and we were able to print out our boarding passes the night before. We also appreciated the noon-time check-out and were able to enjoy a leisurely morning before heading to the airport to catch our flight home. The hotel is centrally located to the El, shopping, sightseeing and nightlife, so we were able to walk everywhere and there were plenty of restaurants nearby to choose from. One really good place we went to around the corner was Sullivan's Steakhouse and would highly recommend it for the excellent food and service (and try their signature drink, "The Knockout"!). Reservations at all restaurants (those who will take them) are highly recommended as the core is very busy at night. Aside from our own informal Oak Park tour (a beautiful, peaceful suburb), we also took the architectural boat tour and highly recommend both as well but again, advance ticket purchases are a must for both! One shop I would no-holds-barred recommend shopping in in Oak Park (across from the OP visitor's centre) is a camera store called " Holiday Camera". We went in to see if I could purchase a memory card for my camera and after checking in the back of the store, the owner, Mike Lebarre, told me they were on order but were not in as yet. He then kindly LENT me, a total stranger, his own camera card and gave me his business card with their address so that I could mail it back to him when I got home to Canada. How amazing is that?! Thanks Mike for making my holiday a memorable one!! Overall, it was a great experience and will definitely be back to the city and to Sax!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not really 4 starThe Sax”
Reviews.Author: EddieC64
Reviews.Content: The Sax hotel is a nice hotel but not really the four star it's rated to be. It's more a 3 star hotel in my opinion. The rooms are a nice size (I had a King size room) and nicely decorated but nothing out of the ordinary. The wall paper in the room looked outdated and cheap. The bathroom was also a nice size, but they only provide two towels for two people and the shampoo and conditioner dispenser in the shower was a little cheap (no individual bathroom products).
