Housekeeping missed some trashed for pick-up and it was obvious they didn't vacuum the room (cookie crumbs were everywhere). Parking was a staggering $52 a night. Internet was $15 a day. There was no coffee in the room, but they provided coffee service i the lobby from 6am-8am. It was in a good location near transportation and restaurants. I've stayed at Days Inn and Holiday Inn which were comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK, location is great”
Reviews.Author: phantom6e
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It is right in the middle of all the nightlife and restaurants and still close to the lake. Besides the location this hotel feels a little to eclectic and warn out. They try for an urban sheik look, but it look like piece meal. The wallpaper was coming off the wall, the bathroom was dark and the floor was dirty. I was in a deluxe king suite for business and my wife came with. The room got the job done and I have no major complaints. If you are looking for an above average hotel, I would skip the sax. If you can get a fair price it would be a good option if you're not looking for more than OK.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jesspress
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls weekend and thought it was very modern, hip, and chic. Check in was easy however parking is pricey at 52$. The room was decorated in what I can only describe as retro-chic but it was cool. The bathroom was roomy and the beds were very springy. In the lobby of the hotel is the Crimson Lounge wich plays new music and gets pretty busy during after hours club time. If you are registered at the hotel you can get in free. It was a good stay, but I would try something new before I went back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CrystalAnn56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sax for a girl's weekend getaway and it was great! There was so much going on in and around our hotel we couldn't even decide what to do! I would definitely stay here again. The staff was great, especially Josh, the doorman who helped us out with choosing places to eat and go. The location was awesome, only a block or two from shopping, bars and good dining. If you haven't visited Chicago before, be sure to bring comfortable shoes to walk around in. The only complaints we had was that the walls were thin and housekeeping wasn't very on top of their game (eg: making beds but leaving our room without toilet paper). We walked in and walked out of Crimson Lounge because it was too loud and we wanted something more laid back. We found great bars on Hubbard which is only a block away. We had such a great time that we considered extending our stay....if only airline fares weren't so high!

Reviews.Title: “Retro Hotel - It was in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DaTalley
Reviews.Content: If you like the Retro look and feel of an older hotel than this is great. I do think it was a great location and great view, however, I had to change rooms because I was given a double bed instead of a King. When I was taken to my new room there were still clothes and a suitcase in the room. Staff must have been busy and they were apologetic. It is located in a great spot in the city. It is near the House of Blues and a variety of other places to see. It also has a great view.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Stay Here Again Next Trip !!”
Reviews.Author: CandymanOfOldForge
Reviews.Content: Hotel check in was a breeze, fast, friendly staff and effecient. We requested a room on the top floor as I have heard the lounge downstairs can get quite noisy. Luckily, our stay was not on a weekend when the lounge is in full swing. Our room was nicely appointed, including the plush, compfy pillow top mattress. Bathroom was clean and the shower has the large head so it was like showring under a relaxing waterfall! We stayed 3 nights and will stay here again on our next trip to Chicago. The restaraunt/coffee shop just off the lobby has good food with attentive waitstaff as well, but I feel the prices are QUITE high for what you order. (9.95 for 3 eggs, toast and like 2.50 for a cup of coffeee...what's up with that?!, should be more like 5.95 TOTAL!). Other than being gouged at the coffee shop, it was a very pleasant stay. (We basically had to eat there, as we were on a time schedule in the morning and did not have any other option.)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sexy and Chic Boutique Hotel that does Chicago proud!”
Reviews.Author: skysdlimit
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived into valet of the Sax I felt the energy of an amazing place smack in the heart of Chicago. Friendly staff greeted us to our King Suite that was a corner unit with views out of this world. The 1100sq ft room was decorated in a modern and contemporary theme with a sexy feel to it. Spacious and clean with all the bells and whistles going off...

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mariemarblehead
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to many sights, as well as most trains. Decor can be a bit spare in the rooms, as the space seems a little to big for the objects that fill it. Otherwise, a good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Very great hotel in value, location and quality.”
Reviews.Author: Deepeddie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days over a long weekend in this very well maintained hotel and was very happy with it. The location is close to everything downtown/the loop/the river/the magnificent mile etc. The hotel staff were quite friendly and accomodated us to our room even tho we arrived at 9am (official check in is normally at 3pm). The room on the 15th floor was very clean, pleasant, comfy and had a great view. Mini bar items looked expensive but mostly same cost as buying something at a lounge. Did not try the lounge or the restraunt below so dunno abt them. I did use the room service which came promptly and was good food too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable spot in close walking distance to lots of great activities”
Reviews.Author: Trips_since_1962
Reviews.Content: Friendly and professional staff, central location, and retro edgy glamour made this a comfortable place to stay. Everyone made us feel welcome. Not quite as luxe as some of the hotels I've stayed in for the price in the same area, but certainly a very good hotel. Our room had a queen bed and overlooked the river. We liked being a short walk from lots of great Chicago shopping, restaurants, museums, and parks.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST beyond a doubt!”
Reviews.Author: Medalert
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sax Chicago for a long weekend. Have stayed before and have always been extremely satisfied with friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, cleanliness of hotel in general and room in particular, quietness even on a busy weekend, location and ease of getting to public transportation or cab (doorman will be more than happy to assist with the cab). So all that said, this trip was absolutely no different than every other time...except maybe even better...if possible. Memorial Day parade started one block from hotel. Chicago river visit is always a nice early morning walk and about 1/2 block away. There's the State street shopping and easy access to many great restaurants, eateries and bars. If you don't find what you're looking for, talk to the concergiere at the hotel. They are more than willing to help. Can use the free internet in the lobby anytime and can print from there. Free coffee in the lobby in the morning....sure wish the hotel had in room coffee pots....but, if that's the worst....nothing to complain about. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Sax offers a great new trendy brand of hotels and yet still provides you with the comfort of being at home.”
Reviews.Author: yohannesogunlesi
Reviews.Content: I've had the luxury of staying at 4 or 5 of the Thompson hotels & all of them have their own unique style. They all are in great locations that help for you tour the most popular areas of the prospective cities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Carina311
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the city center, with friendly staff and nice spacious rooms. Absolutely recommendable. So many things in walking distance. Concierge service is outstanding! Next time in Chicago there is no choice but SAX Hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, top-notch service”
Reviews.Author: gvm
Reviews.Content: A large group of us recently stayed at the Sax Chicago for a friend's bachelor party. This hotel deserves a great review for the quality of our stay, great location and especially for the top-notch service. I was in e-mail correspondence with the Hotel Manager as well as two of the concierges for a month or so leading up to the trip. Everyone was extremely helpful in assisting with our planning of the bachelor party, offering suggestions (but not pushing anything in particular) and arranging reservations where need be. I always received helpful advice and prompt replies. The hotel itself was in a great location, was very clean and we all enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: valweb
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fantastic! The service is outstanding, the hotel is gorgeous, so hip and trendy! We felt like Hollywood royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service fantastic Location (Stayed April 29-May 1, 2011)”
Reviews.Author: miwinelover
Reviews.Content: The moment we stepped out of our automobile, the service began. Valet parking and the bell hops were friendly and very helpful. We walked in the door to a somewhat spartan lobby with crystal vases inside glass cases that are used as the front desk. The front desk staff were very friendly and customer service oriented. The Concierge Catherine was very helpful in setting up dinner reservvations for us as it was our anniversary and we wanted something upscale yet not "stuffy", Benny's Chop House was the perfect choice. (I will write a review on that). Once we had dinner reservations set we entered the elevators to our room. WE were on the 15th floor in a king deluxe. We overllooked the House of Blues (we were high above their building) and were overlooking the Chicago river and those "bee hive condo's. The room was clean, fresh, modern, large bathroom (with fantastic bath products), flat screen tv's, and honor bar. The room only lacked a in-room coffee machine (coffee was hard to find unless you were up before 0800-which coffee is served in the lobby 0600-0800) but who is up that early when your on a get-away. The hotel shares the building with Bin 32 (my favorite wine bar in Chicago--Juan the bartender is the best server I have ever had-anywhere). Crimson Bar inside the hotel, is dark adn mysterious and the progressive house music that Jason the DJ played was perfect for the environment. Travlers of all ages were in the house and once again service was top notch. Next time we go to Chicago, we will definately stay at the SAX Hotel. THe location is central to everything Chicago. 10-15 minute walk to Bloomingdales on Michigan Ave. 5-10 minute walk to the loop (Macy's/Marshall Fields/theater district) 10 minute walk to the Mechandise Mart. We travel to Chicago frequently (we live in Michigan) and we will be staying at the SAX again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location and touches But.....”
Reviews.Author: tmoo6
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the location of the sax hotel. I got a great deal on travel zoo and the hotel for the most part was good. I do have to agree with the last review that the house keeping was lacking and although the hotel had great offers to take advantage of the bath soap, and the maid service was very cheap with supplies such as soap and items you would expect to have and they had mini fridge stocked with so many items to make you spend lots of money you couldn't hardly keep your own personal items in it. In all I enjoyed the hotel and if they just give more attention to the little things such as soaps etc you would be even better.They did have free tickets to house of blues free appetizers in the lounge which was great and nice bar and music.

Reviews.Title: “Chintzy”
Reviews.Author: travelsw/dog
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an attractive facade with glitzy decor and dim lighting. But the important features that one expects in an expensive hotel such as comfortable beds and bedding are sorely lacking at the Sax. Holiday Inn would be more comfortable and less stingy with hand soap, towels, and drinking glasses. The housekeeping was spotty at best. I had to request drinking glasses and we didn't get a fresh bar of handsoap until our fifth day at the hotel. The beds were saggy with mattress toppers that were too small, cheap pillows, and institutional style sheets. This hotel is not for the business traveler--Wifi is $10.95 per day and the hotel doesn't even provide ink pens in the rooms. The only impressive aspect of the hotel was the excellent service provided by the friendly doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VANMARCIN
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Great location. We stayed at the Sax for the Easter weekend. Room was comfortable, the bathroom was really spacious. The hotel is centrally located, walking distance to many attractions. Recommend Einsteins for breakfast. The bagels are wonderful. Pay visit the House of Blues.... we met a great young man working there, he took the time to show us around the theatre. The live entertainment was wonderful. The parking was free through a Travelzoo deal. A very nice bonus. We enjoyed the the river walk and admiring the great architecture. Would certainly visit Chicago again. There is so much to see!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Clean and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Chranimel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location in marina city and was a great starting point to get to where you needed to go. We had a room on the 16th floor and heard very little noise especially for such a urban setting, great beds- slept like babies. The hotel service was excellent staff was always very cheerful and willing to help. Quite an exciting location as during our stay LA galaxy was there and got a chance to engage in some particularly interesting conversations... The only downfall was that i had lost my phone in the chicago cab and the local phonecalls were not included... there was some outrageous cost per minute. So if you need to make reservations for restuarants or make any local calls i would suggest trying to arrange as best before arriving to the hotel. There was however complimentary internet use which did help a little... Overall a great experience and would stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...once everything was taken care of.”
Reviews.Author: weddingurl
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room for 3 nights. The first night they didn't have any double rooms. No problem. Only the floor on one side of the bed was wet. We got transferred to another room with a roll away bed. The room was small enough that if we had used the roll away bed, 1 of us would not have been able to access the bathroom, and it would have been a fire hazard. The next day we were transferred to a double room. Great, except the toilet didn't flush properly. We were eventually given a suite which was very nice. While the experience was frustrating, the hotel staff were VERY nice about everything, and the manager sent us a complimentary fruit and cheese tray in the suite. The decor is nice, it's centrally located, and they did go out of their way to make sure we were comfortable for the remainder of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, wonderful location and value!”
Reviews.Author: amd6551
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Sax in downtown Chicago and had a great time. The double room on the eleventh floor was lovely and suited our stay beautifully. The staff were very helpful and gave us directions and tips to everything we wanted to see during our stay. There was a Einstein's Bagel a very short walk from the hotel where we went for breakfast. You can walk to many of Chicago's highlights and taking a cab never cost us more than $10 including tip. Our room was very quiet and well appointed. Valet parking (included, as part of a special rate) was a wonderful perk for us. We would definitely stay at the Sax Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A nice 3 Star Hotel for a 4 Star price on Hotliar”
Reviews.Author: Stonesteps
Reviews.Content: Firstly thank you all other reviews as I was able to get a quiet room but had to have the shower head replaced in my bathroom which was only a shower stall no bathtub. I booked on Hotwire (or Hotliar) where they promise a main brand hotel. The room was clean and adequate but I could have gotten a much nicer 3 star hotel for a cheaper price. The room was small, dark and no dresser. The staff was very courteous and helpful and location is great, as long as you have a room facing the back. Thank god for may tethering to my droid phone to avoid their internet charges

Reviews.Title: “great spot for st patricks day...fab view of the green river”
Reviews.Author: flizzer
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel with a tip on deals from the trip advisor forum and got a good deal...after reading the reviews (and seeing and hearing the house of blues as I arrived) I asked for a high floor and a quiet area of the hotel....i was on the 16th floor in a great room with a view of the river, the marina towers and 35 wacker drive one of my fav buildings in chicago...very convienient for my evening at the oriental seeing hair...and for viewing the green river on st patricks day!! I had a problem...my toilet overflowed...and the response was quick and clean up promt and thorough....i think this is where you find out if you're in a good hotel with good service! loved this hotel!!i

Reviews.Title: “Slept well here”
Reviews.Author: CAWeekender29
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a good stay, the highlight for me was how quiet my room was. When staying at a downtown hotel I expect a bit of noise, however I slept like a baby at this hotel. Check in and check out was easy, the room was comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious. I especially liked the rainfall shower head. The shower had larger bottles of shampoo, which I liked for reducing the waste of small bottles, thanks Hotel Sax. The gym was a little awkward to find, and the lighting in the room was a little dim for me. Other than that, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JustaGuyOakPark_IL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned an "escape weekend" at the Hotel Sax...wow, we really should have spent a few dollars more and stayed at a nice place! The location in River North is great, so we enjoyed that. But outside of the hotel lobby (which was nice and funky and cool), the place just needed to be cared for. Sagging ceiling tiles and burnt out lights in the hallway on the way to our room made for a creepy atmosphere. Our room was very small, clean enough, but needed work -- the bathroom was 30 years old with a moldy shower curtain that wasn't long enough to reach the floor. Terrible water pressure, no hot water...arrgghh! Plus, we could hear everything in the rooms next door on both sides and from above and below. We got no sleep whatsoever and (as other posters have noted) heard the thumping from the Crimson Lounge until 4am even though we were on the 6th floor. Just spend a few dollars more and enjoy the many other hotels in the area that are nicer and better managed. The Hotel Sax is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel; beware of parking”
Reviews.Author: MarkWing
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, hip hotel. Very nice accommodations. Great rooms. Comfortable beds. Excellent bathrooms. Got a great price here through Hotwire. If you're driving, beware of the steep parking fees, however. There's no self-parking, only valet at $52 a day. Lots of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay in the heart of the Chicago Loop.”
Reviews.Author: cs1776
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, I was warmly greeted and allowed to leave my bag there (I was waiting for a friend). The lobby offers an antique and comfortable atmosphere, with a staff regularly checking on you. The Crimson Lounge (the hotel bar) is equally warm and inviting, with the best selection of Scotch and Cognac I've seen the USA, and with reasonable prices. The room was spacious and comfortable, and perfectly quiet. It was neat and tidy, and the next morning I barely heard the cleaning staff. The decor was minimalistic and it made for a comfortable and quiet place to sleep. Being right by the loop it's close to a lot of Chicago attractions, but alas I'm a neighbourhood guy, and was glad to see it was close (2 blocks) to the CTA. Not only do I recommend this hotel, I already have to several business colleagues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “No need to settle for this”
Reviews.Author: Illinois4321
Reviews.Content: There are way too many places to stay in this area of Chicago to settle for this place. First, let me list the good since it wasn't all bad: 1. My room was clean 2. The staff was very helpful and nice 3. Certain amenities were free, such as computer access, gym access, and a fridge for my room. 4. Some would consider the decorations attractive, but that's subjective. Now for the bad: 1. The room smelled like old books 2. The bed was very worn out and uncomfortable. 3. The TV doesn't have a lot of channels and it's HD but most of the channels aren't so the picture quality is very bad. 4. The gym is very lackluster. Only three treadmills, three elipticals, one exercise bike, a very poor selection of dumbbells, and a life-style machine that I couldn't get the pin to fit into to adjust the weight plates, so I couldn't use it. 5. The 3 computers they have for internet use are outdated, and you have to be standing to use them. It would be nicer if you can sit, and nicer yet if they would spend 40 dollars to get better mice than the cheap, rollerball ones they use that don't move very well. 6. Worst of all, my room was situated right above where the line forms for the House of Blues. No big deal when people are in line before the show starts because it's early. And even though there was quite a line before the show, it wasn't that bad. But afterward, it was a different story. I'm guessing most of the concert goers were drunk, because they were 100x louder after the show than before. The staff at the House of Blues manages the line before the show, so you would think they would tell people to leave the property after the show, but nope. There were people loitering there for hours. Literally, hours. They know there's a hotel right across the driveway, so if I was the manager, that would never happen. By that point, I was already in bed, and I didn't want to pack everything back up and get dressed to move to another room. You might say that I was stupid for staying here, and if I would have known this was the hotel I'd be staying at, you'd be right. But I arranged my hotel stay through Hotwire only knowing that it was a "4 star" hotel and a couple of the amenities. They did not say it was right next to a noisy landmark, otherwise I would have avoided this place like the plague. And even if it weren't for the location and lack of House of Blues staff dealing with people loitering for *hours*, this still doesn't deserve four stars because of the 5 other issues I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but don't try sleeping”
Reviews.Author: cmbassett
Reviews.Content: Sax is a really lovely hotel in a great location. However, if you want to sleep before the club in the lobby closes at 4am you may have a problem. Even on the 8th floor, your bed will be shaking with techno beats and screaming girls.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: chadp1
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. River North Area is great for bars and restaurants. Hotel was top shelf. Little bit of eclectic vibe to it without being pretentious. Room was large, comfortable, and well laid out. Big bathroom, and comfortable beds and linens. Great TV and nicely decorated. Room was on North side of hotel, and a bit loud, but you're going to get that staying downtown. Pillows weren't great, but we didn't try to request additional or better ones. I would absolutely stay here again. Rates are pretty attractive, and it's a cool place to stay. We live in the suburbs and have already recommended hotel to friends looking for a night out downtown. I'm ususally a Marriott guy. Sax was much nicer than the Courtyard, and half the price of the Rennaissance (and just as nice), both of which are nearby. Only complaint was parking. $52 to park overnight. Even in Chicago thats silly. Seeing that on the bill as we were leaving left a little bit of a sour taste, but, what are you going to do. We'll leave the car at home next time.

Reviews.Title: “The great keeps getting greater”
Reviews.Author: Medalert
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sax is a treasure...in the right place, at the right time. Relaxed but close to everything. Great spot on the river. Staff ever so helpful and friendly from the desk to the consierge to the doormen. Wine cellar and restaurant nice touch. Will be back many times and recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: KOttoSix
Reviews.Content: Talk about Central! We were in town for a fun excursion and didn't even have a set agenda. Being very familiar with Chicago, we had our fav's lined up but it was a little too cold to walk as far as some -- so the very excellent conceirge, Sarah, directed us to some new favorites. We never walked farther than a few blocks to find everything from excellent Blooly Mary's at brunch to the local's half price oyster bar happy hour. As far as the Sax as a facility, it is first rate. The rooms are plush and mod and the views are what you want in the city. The snow coming down over the river was like a Monet painting. Don't forget to hang out at the Lobby bar with live music on Friday and if for any reason you get bored or have the DT's from missing your video game console, you should check out the Tech Lounge where we had a blast playing RockBand. We're already talking about coming back in the Spring. Stay tuned...

Reviews.Title: “Animal hair, snotty bell hop & Tech room always closed:(”
Reviews.Author: Nina408
Reviews.Content: We researched for weeks on finding a hotel room while in Chicago for the weekend. We are both in our early 30's, so still want that different/funky vibe in our rooms. We also have a teen who loves video games, so when we seen their tech room we were psyched!! The website shows a beautiful mix of funky and classy, with a wonderful location to downtown-we were sold. We arrive to a cool lobby with beautiful furniture and a friendly front desk lady. The lady told us our parking would be free when we asked when we should pay the $25.00 the site advised it would cost a night. We told her again that the site said we indeed needed to pay, though we would love it to be free-we could not hustle the nice lady. She insisted on her computer it said our parking was indeed free, it was comp by the manager-SWEET!!! We get to our room and it was FILTHY and cheap looking. The chair had a big rip in it, the garbage had some kind of liquid in it, but gross of all-our bed had CRUST on the sheets and blankets. Now to be fair, it looked like sauce from food, but it was every where on both beds. When I dropped my key in disgust and went to pick it up, there was looked like short dog hair in the carpet with a million crumbs. I called the front desk right away and asked for another room, the man who helped me on the phone was very blah to me and about it, but I think that was just his voice. He was quick to get someone up to help us carry our bags to another room, which I was happy about. The man that came was the bell boy we had seen when checked in and was nice when we arrived, but when we opened the door he started questioning us on the rooms state-like he did not trust us. He kept giving us strange looks while standing in the room as we gathered our things, till I snapped(sorry to say-I still feel bad) and told him if he had a problem with what we're saying to look around himself instead of standing in the door way pretty much calling us liars. He said he was sorry and grabbed ONE BAG and took us to another room. It was the exact same style room, so it made me even more mad we were being treated like liars, he made it seem we were just trying to get an upgrade..lol. This room was much more clean, though still run down and cheap seeming-I'll take cheap over dirty any day. Well, we woke up early to find a bill under our door for the damn parking!!! I took it as they were upset to have to change our rooms and decided to charge us anyway. So, I called down and spoke to the same blah/nice front desk man, who told me it does say free in the system, but will talk to the manager. He called back and was very sorry to tell us it was a mistake and we did owe the 25.00-even though we tried to pay it when we first got in. Fine, we had a taping to go to and had to run-so I asked him if we could get the tech room open for our soon while we were gone. We were told the night before the tech room was only open from 4:30 till midnight(something close to those hours), but we could request someone open it up prev to those hours. Well, we got in @ 7pm and it was closed-he said due to cleaning and that's why tomorrow they would open it for our son and any other guest to enjoy before we checked out. Well, when I asked in the morning, they said their was no way they could open it up till 4:30 today and the front desk & bell staff was mistaken. We were livid again, but in a rush. We asked if we can at least get a later check out and they said the latest they could do was 1pm-fine. I travel a lot and love staying at hotels-staying at a good hotel makes me feel like I'm living a different life. This place had me longing for my son's dirty room and the yelling to clean it up..lol. The price was OK, but at anything over $120.00 a night, I would expect a clean room and keep what they have on their site open as promised. Again, I stay at a lot of hotels and in the last 8 years, this was the worse place I have ever stayed at. Other people may have had better luck, maybe it was just my room, that night front desk, bell stand, my luck in general-I will never stay here again nor will I recommend this place to any of my co-workers or human in general. P.S. I am not being bitter-I've never wrote a negative review-ever. If it was just bad service or a closed tech room-fine. I paid 120.00 for a night, 25.00 for parking to be called a liar, to be lied to and to sleep in dirty room.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly funky boutique hotel but friendly and without any attitude”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Porridge
Reviews.Content: Not knowing Chicago too well, I was happy with the central location (next to House of Blues). The hotel is a bit self-consciously funky, but unlike the W was quite well lit, and you don't have to wear black to fit in. The best point for me was that everyone I met was super nice and helpful with no attitude and a sense of humor. I stayed three nights. The room was comfy and relaxed. It was pleasantly funky but not over the top and the bathroom was positively normal. Not sure I would get the two fake snakeskin armchairs for my own living room, but otherwise I felt right at home. Big mirror, great view. Heating worked fine, but needed tweaking with the weather (it was super cold). Blackout curtains really worked, bed was comfy. Overall it was very quiet and I got a lot of rest, although I was woken up (at 9am!) by the cleaning staff shouting and laughing. I tried the wine bar (Bin 36) and had a lot of fun there. I only chose this hotel because I got a great deal on the price, but I would definitely stay there again (assuming the price is still right!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! thanks for everything!”
Reviews.Author: xxxx190454
Reviews.Content: nice decor, excellent breakfast, friendly staff - what else can you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Food & Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_S_Chicago
Reviews.Content: The front desk people were tops and they handled the checkin/out cordially and quickly. Staff was very friendly and helpful when advising on directions and restaurant recommendations. I felt that their service was top-notch and professional. The room itself was very clean, from a well made bed to nice towels to a bright and shiny bathroom. The was also nicely laid out and very well decorated, I mean very hip! As my business was downtown, its central location couldn't have been easier, walking distance from the business district. Getting to the hotel from the airports was easy too because the hotel is just a 3-block walk from the "El" stop. All in all I was very impressed, thanks Sax!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, great location, but ask for a room high up, and far from elevator”
Reviews.Author: Winetourist80
Reviews.Content: Quirky little details such as decor and snakeskin chair have been more than covered, but overall the hotel rooms are large, comfortable, with large beds and good size bathrooms. With the bar and restaurant downstairs I would imagine that rooms lower down might get noisy and the view of car park tower not great, also I was near elevator so a little noisy. However next time I go back I will ask for a different room. The wine themed restaurant is a little cold in decor but the staff really know their wine and makes for a fun evening!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Our Christmas Trip!”
Reviews.Author: QR3
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decieded to get away for the Christmas holiday this year. We went to Chicago for Christmas Eve and Chrstmas Day. We went to Priceline and got Sax Hotel (Old House of Blues Hotel). We took the train to Chicago and thought we would drop our bags at the hotel because check in was not till 3pm. When we dropped our bags off the hotel let us check in at 11am. The hotel was clean and we stayed on the 15th floor out of 16 :) Our room was clean and the beds were so comfortable. The fitness center was nice but we opted to run on Michigan Avenue Christmas morning. Most of everything was closed and barely any foot traffic so we took advantage of that. We found plenty to do here during our stay from the German open market at the Daily Plaza to Navy Pier. Walking around downtown Chicago on Christmas Eve looking decorations while it was snowing was the best. We had a great dinner at Sullivans on Dearborn. Sleeping in Christmas Day was the best! The hotel was quiet and the staff was friendly. We both would stay thier again!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas visit w/ the family was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: shytown
Reviews.Content: Took my wife and two young children (1 & 4) up to Chicago to see the big-city during the Holidays. We put in a bid for $100 on a 4 star hotel along Michigan/River North and were lucky to have the Sax take our bid. The location was great for us as it's centrally located - easy access to both the loop and Michigan Ave. We took the short walk across the river and visited both the old Marshall Fields building (now Macy's) and saw their window displays and visited the Kristkindlmarket. All the previous posts that rave about the Hotel's staff are right on the money. From the bellhops, to valet (we actually parked the car up in Lincoln Park and took the Brown Line back, saving the Hotel's $50 parking fee), to the front-desk staff, they were all wonderfully polite and courteous, all eager to accommodate our needs. Although Priceline booked us into a room with one queen bed, we paid the extra $20 a night for two double beds and a lot more living space. We thought the extra space was well worth the extra charge. The room was very spacious and clean, with a full wet-bar, bath robes, and flat panel television. The room did have an art-deco style theme, but I thought it was very classy and well done. Beautiful long drapes hung across the windows, which we used to encircle our child's pack-n-play creating a nice tent-like effect. The only downside to the hotel was the lack of a traditional lounge area - but with two kids and so much to do and see in the city, this was the least of our concerns. Overall we were very pleased with our stay and will definitely stay there again, given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Kalepe
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three night stay here very much. Both the room and bed were comfortable. It was quiet. I never heard anyone walking and/or talking in the hallway like you do at some hotels or the usual door slams. Didn't care for the vinyl chair, but then again that was better than dealing with dirty upholstery. Great location--right in the theater district, yet close enough to walk the Magnificent Mile. Housekeeping did a great job every day. Everyone was polite. Cons: No coffee maker :-( My husband would run to the restaurant next door every morning to buy two cups of coffee. The toilet usually needed two flushes--it seemed to work well every other flush. Internet cost $10/day. We were charged for Swedish fish (yuck) and there was an extra open container that appeared the second day we were there although neither one of us even touched any of those containers. They did quickly removed the charge though. Didn't appreciate the last morning when we went to eat breakfast at the attached restaurant next door. For some reason the door had a sign that said to use the main (outside) entrance. We went to the first set of doors to go outside only to find they were locked. We went all the way back to our rooms to get our coats before heaing outdoors--in the snowstorm--to walk to the restaurant entrance. Once inside we observed many people going in and out of the door with the sign saying not to! Guess we shouldn't have been rule-followers. The cons were all minor though and we really did have a great and comfortable stay and we would definitely come here again. It was a great home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, but new management has stripped many of its charms”
Reviews.Author: jolotraveler
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Chicago, IL, I have stayed at the House of Blues/Hotel Sax many times. Recently, the hotel has undergone a management change. Unfortunately, this has meant that the hotel now charges for internet access and the new staff aren't as friendly as former staff. As well, I used to get complimentary parking at the hotel, having been a frequent guest, and now I no longer get any perks. The hotel is very chic, but there are many other options in the city that will offer more for less. As a result of the changes at this hotel, I will likely no longer return. On the plus side, this hotel is centrally located, right next to the river and walking distance to State St and Michigan Ave shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great decor and rooms, good location!”
Reviews.Author: StyleTraveller30
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sax in December 2010. The design is a beautiful balance of modern and French romantic, the rooms are a good size with comfortable beds. The olives and martini shaker in the room are a great touch! The bar is perfect for early evening cocktails or partying into the night on the weekends. We would seriously recommend the hotel to those with style! A great hotel which would be at the top of our list for the next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review on Hotel Sax”
Reviews.Author: SpacemanAlbuquerque
Reviews.Content: I took my family to Chicago and we stayed here one night for $240 from Hotwire. There was a convention that weekend, so prices were stiff around chicago. Negatives - The room was small for four people and there was duct tape across the bathroom sink. So I was disappointed in the room. Breakfast was $20/person, yet much of the food was prepackaged (e.g., scrambled eggs were from a mix). Neutral - location is OK, building nothing special. Positives - Excellent staff - front desk, valet parking etc. They deserve kudos. I don't think I would stay there for a price. i felt like we received a poor room because we booked through Hotwire for a supposedly decent price. There's alot of other hotels out there, I would shop around.

Reviews.Title: “They charge you extra after you check out!”
Reviews.Author: Asilcu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Sax for two nights. When we received the credit card statement the following month, it was an extra charge of $28. When called, I was told we "consumed two red bulls & a bottle of vodka," which we never did. I never had red bull in my life! And my wife is pregnant, so it doesn't make sense to drink alcohol either! It was shocking that they thought we were not telling them the truth. This $28 does not make them rich or make us poor, but beware! Don't go there, if you do, check the mini-bar at check in!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay at the Sax”
Reviews.Author: msu17
Reviews.Content: Booked the Sax on Priceline for $100/nt. We are traditional hotel people, but the trendiness of the Sax was nice and not overdone. Pros: Great location, very quiet in the room, comfortable bed, spacious room and bathroom, great shower pressure, nice TV with HD channels, always an elevator available Cons: Not an attractive building (old office building), average view, small sink in bathroom, high internet charge Overall, we were very happy with the Sax. It was a quiet retreat in the heart of the city, and the location is perfect. The bus-stops on either side of the hotel connect you to every part of the city, so I recommend getting CTA passes and using Google maps for schedules. For the money, this hotel was an excellent value and we were glad to have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LizVandy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway in chicago. We found a great rate ($109) on Travelzoo. The hotel has trendy decor; very small lobby area. Great lounge called Crimson Lounge and a restaurant/wine bar called Bin 36 that is attached to the hotel. The restaurant was great. Front desk staff and the guys working out front were great. Very helpful; always had a bad for us within seconds. The location was great; close walk to Magnificnet Mile.and steps away from the Chicago River. The room was small and it was obvious the bathroom hadn't been cleaned properly upon our arrival but other than that it was a great stay and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and fashionable hotel good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Ijonesy
Reviews.Content: The Sax is ideally located close to the river and not far from anything for the first time visitor i.e. shops, Navy Pier (15 min walk) and the trolley tour pick ups to see everything else. Also, very close to Maggianos (10 mins walk) and Smith & Wollensky (next door) which is where we ate on the two nights we were there - both excellent restaurants worthy of their reviews. Einsteins Bagels have been mentioned but the Corner Bakery across the river (5 mins) is great for a cooked and leisurely breakfast to set you up for the day. The two concierge's (Catherine and Samantha) were friendly, efficient and professional - and couldn't have been more helpful when we had to change plans around (Tornado) weather. The Bellhops were also very friendly, polite and chatty and made you feel very welcome. Just two downsides: WiFi should be free to guests in a hotel with this tariff and the two receptionists at check-in were "ever so slightly so you would hardly notice" surly and rude when we requested rollaway beds in our rooms. However, they were the exception and the on duty manager smilingly and professionally dealt with the bed issue. Overall, a great stay, mostl;y friendly staff and ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “A unique boutique hotel but needs more staffing”
Reviews.Author: kebiewj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located. Not quite as close to Magnificent Mile as I would like. We were greeted quickly as check in. Our room was decorated very nice and had many newer amenities. I was really interested in using their game room but was told it was mid-week and it wouldn't be available. The next day we explored Chicago, when we returned our room had not been cleaned. I went down to the front desk and first they tried to understand why it hadn't been cleaned instead of attending to my immediate need. They ended up moving us to the room next door but did not offer anything for our inconveniences. There was construction in front of the hotel but it didn't cause any traffic issues.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: smallon
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed in the Hotel Sax and loved every minute of it. The hotel has a great location, rigth on the water and just off Millionaires Row - excellent for shopping! The hotel itself is beautiful. Very Chic. From the spacious bedrooms to the sultry coctail bar, i couldn't have been more impressed. The hotel staff were delightful and they couldn't do enough to help. We visit Chicago annually and i know for sure where i'll be staying next year!

Reviews.Title: “Unique inviting hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigApple41
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 2 weeks ago. It was a business and pleasure trip. I enjoyed the uniqueness of the hotel and its furnishings. The Chef Concierge-Catherine- was fabulous. She remembered our names and helped us tremendously. The location is wonderful. Our room was small and the lighting was poor. The only other problem was there were only two small drawers. i asked for and received extra hangers which helped. Perhaps our room was not a four star room as we booked through PL. I recommend the hotel highly but I would request better lights in the room and a dresser of some sort. I loved the funky furniture throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, fairly comfortable, fun.”
Reviews.Author: Soda100
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish, comfortable, well-located hotel. It has a funky, hip, yet accessible feel. Terrific location, steps away from great shopping, a few streets over from great restaurants, easy to take a walk downtown, and my room had a view of the river. It was easy to get to the museums, to the Shedd, and to the couple of business meetings I had on Michigan Ave. I got in late at night via taxi (so I can't comment on parking), and I was initially worried because there's a lively, crowded (good people-watching!) club downstairs. No worries, I didn't hear a thing when I wanted to get to sleep. The hotel really is geared, some might say, "young," but I just think it's hip and in step with the times and a nice break from big chains. You can tell they're trying to accommodate how people live and what they want when they travel. For example, there's a cool media room you can book for free where you can play xbox and wii and hang out. So I'll say it's definitely a new 'hotel experience' for me, but a good one! The room was comfortable and reasonably sized and tidy. I was in a non-smoking room but strangely there was what looked like a cigarette burn in one of the end tables. The hallways maybe are a little more dark and slightly dank than I'd like andI think the ventilation in the room wasn't as good as I would have liked, either, but overall ok there. It does seem like I have to note how hip and chic the style of the hotel and room is, and I really liked it, but really it has to be comfortable and serviceable or else it just fails as a hotel, and Hotel Sax was comfortable and had good check-in service (even if they had to shout over the music downstairs late at nightâ€¦ it was totally quiet during the day). The concierge helped me get connected with an architecture tour and recommended a couple of good places to eat and shop. Before arriving, I requested a non-feather hypo-allergenic room, and they made it up accordingly, which was great. There are plenty of soft towels and a bathrobe to use, and the toiletries are good quality. The building seems to be a remodeled older building, and they did a nice job of updating the bathroom but retaining some elements that let you know the building was built awhile ago. I never had breakfast at the hotel, so I can't comment on it, but I did have lunch at the downstairs restaurant, Bin 36, and it was very good, had a salad and a gourmet sandwich. Pricey, but you really are getting something special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: RDWiles
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Sax for our weekend celebration of our one-year wedding anniversary. Despite Chicago being very crowded that weekend due to a few major conferences, the receptionist was able to accommodate our requests for a king room. They were also kind enough to sign for and store our slice of wedding cake. :) We flew into Chicago and took the Blue Line train from the airport to downtown Chicago and really enjoyed paying $5 rather than $50. Especially as we zipped past the standstill traffic. :) We loved our room. It was spacious, had a little view of the river, and the decor was fun. The bathroom was nice and spacious. It was definitely the nicest hotel we've stayed at in awhile. The location was great, close to lots of Chicago attractions. The downstairs bar was beautiful (not exactly a hotspot, but a great place to grab a before or after-dinner drink). We both used the fitness center. It's not super swanky, but the equipment is in good condition. We ordered from room service once late night. We decided to avoid the $40 pizza, but did give in to a $17 plate of hummus. I must admit, it was pretty dang good hummus, though. There's a bagel shop right across the street, so we did breakfasts there. Even though I had a computer, we decided to avoid the surcharge and use the computers in the lobby. Perfectly adequate! We booked our room through PL and were still treated like Kings. I'd highly, highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rosie181818
Reviews.Content: I'm not one for Tripadvisor reviews unless something is extra special. The Hotel Sax is that. Perfect service, lobby, decor, staff, bar, the rooms were also clean yet quirky. The Sax has thought of absolutely everything before you even think of it- down to posting you new keys through the door during the night when you've lost your own! Great shower, cool view, just everything we could have asked for and more. The hotel bar- Crimson Lounge, was also one of the best hotels bars I've ever been to, a hard feat when a bar is inside a hotel. great decor, great drinks, just an amazing hotel. I'd recommend it to anyone- colleagues, clients and friends/family too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hold your breath”
Reviews.Author: vurve
Reviews.Content: I cant say this hotel is what there making it out to be! You will spend a large amount of money for a hotel that should not be given 4 stars. The decor hmm how do you explain what the look there going for. When I was checking out, I had a charge added to my bill from the mini bar, well there is no mini bar. Unless if you want to call a tray with items placed on top of it a mini bar. DO NOT PICK ANYTHING UP FROM THE TRAY. I was charged for something that I did not consume I explained to the rep that I did not use it, and I was told that it would stay on my credit card, and someone would look into and call me back. No one ever called back, so I had to make the call myself. I was told that the charge would not be placed on my card. Well guess what its still on my card. Overall I cant say this is a hotel I would give another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Douglas L
Reviews.Content: Very small dark rooms. Location very good. Priceline bid of $200 accepted - but was supposed to be a 4-star hotel - this was not. Economical. good location. good beds - room AC worked well. But setup was funky. ...whole hotel kinda weird. Worked OK for a weekend when some of the other hotels were pretty pricey...and we didn't spend a whole lotta time in the room

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: I have severe allergies. When a place is not clean, I wheeze and suffer. This place was spotless. The staff were top notch. They truly pampered every guest. The bar is gorgeous, but a little too loud an hip hop for the over 40 crew. Bin 39 next door offers wonderful cheese and wine tastings as well as meals. There are many greatrestaurants within a block of the hotel. The only negative for the room is that the bathroom is small with no storage space. However, the room had a coffee maker, a mini bar/frig an iron, a safe and reading material. The fitness room was pretty basic, but adequate; free Internet in the lobby where they printed our boarding passes. They also serve delicious coffee and lemonade in the lobby. We loved this place! Every employee went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: vegasboundgroup
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sax is conveniently located in the downtown area near Marina City. I had a great view, but the front desk staff needs a lesson in decorum (one spoke so loudly that she could be heard in the front of the lobby checking guests in and repeating their room numbers out loud. The desk staff also don't follow through with what they promise guests. However, because I was just there for the weekend, and the hotel was convenient to where I wanted to be, it was livable.

Reviews.Title: “Lumpy beds, dumpy bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: Thalina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, and I was glad to depart at the end. First of all: beds were lumpy. Seriously. Very uncomfortable mattress and hard pillows. Two: Our bathroom (huge while oddly shaped) came with a mini-shower and bathtub. Hardly first class. And they only gave us only two bath towels (isn't four the norm?). The toiletries were generic and not nice. Bathroom light was harsh fluorescent, and the heat lamp above kept going on and off. The shops are a bit of a hike (nearest Starbucks is a couple of blocks away). It's sandwiched between the business district and the shopping district in this odd little run down area, so the surrounding ambiance isn't nice. Get ready to shell out $10 a night PER COMPUTER to user the Internet. They were not accommodating with a late check out request; we had to call twice and practically beg for them to give us a one hour extension. If you're looking for an upscale, modern hotel, I'd recommend checking out the James or the Felix, both nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Sax Hotel Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Tourist60763
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated right downtown, within walking distance to city attractions - Magnificent Mile, Millennium Park, Chicago Cultural Centre; we took a short direct trip on the subway from Ohare and a 5 min walk to the hotel. Restaurants and supermarkets (Whole Foods & Traders Joe) within walking distance. Unfortunately, the beds were uncomfortable, sunken mattress. All in all, the price was worth it (we got a good deal from Quikbook.com.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sax is run down and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Fearsie
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Hotel Sax because I wanted a unique hotel for a special occassion. I wanted to find a unique, boutique hotel that was maybe a step above the standard 4-star chain hotels in the area. Hotel Sax receives a 4-star rating from most travel sites and boasts that it's a "luxury" hotel. In addition, it's funky, modern interior design is a major selling point. And while the lobby and Crimson Lounge areas are very unique with many sexy design elements, the actual hotel rooms are terrible. You'd think a hotel that is so invested in their reputation as a design showplace would go to the trouble of keeping up the appearence of the property...but you'd be wrong. Upon entering my room, I saw cracks in the walls where paint was chipping away, wall paper that was coming unglued at the seams, stained window treatments, worn out chairs, nicks in the furniture and electrical cords wrapped in tape in plain view. (See Pictures) The room was spacious, but it was also filthy. The electrical outlet dock on the nightstand was not only broken (so the only working outlet was in the bathroom...which is where I had to plug in my computer) it was caked with what can only be described as "gunk". There was mildew between the tile in the bathroom. The entire room was covered in dust. There were cigarette burn marks on the curtains and holes in the sheets. Oh, and to top it all off, when I went to use the lotion in the bathroom after my shower I discovered that it was only 1/3 full. Yes, it was used. When I checked in at 5pm, there were dirty dishes in the hallway left over from someone's room service. At 6:30 when I left the room to explore the rest of the hotel, the dishes were still there. When I came back to the room to get ready to go out for the evening at 7:30 the dishes were STILL in the hallway...and there was a roomservice maid with her cart cleaning one of the rooms. She had to have steered her cart out of the way not to roll over the dirty dishes, yet there they sat, untouched. Needless to say, I would not consider staying here again. I will say this: The staff I encountered was lovely. Very friendly and helpful. I blame the sorry state of this hotel on the management. With so many hotels to choose from within walking distance of this one, I can't imagine why cleanliness or maintenence isn't a bigger priority for them.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel, but the beds are so uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: ekevitz
Reviews.Content: I give the hotel 5 stars on everything except for the comfort of the beds. My back was so sore every morning that I could hardly move, and I am only 28. When arriving at the hotel, it has great style, very good service and the location is awesome. It is walking distance to the shops on the magnificent mile and right next to the house of Blues. The hotel hallways are a little spooky but in a very cool and hip kind of way. I think its like entering the Tower of Terror hotel at Disney World, but again, in a cool way. The hotel is immaculately clean and no issues on that side. The rooms are also very clean, a little on the small side, but with tons of style and touches. We did a lot of shopping, so by the end of the trip, our room was filled with bags and a little difficult to walk around in because of the lack of space. The shower was also small, but in the end, I didn't mind the size. OK, now the problem. The beds are horrible. They feel fine at first, but after a night of sleep, I was aching in the morning. Hotel Sax management, you have got to replace the beds. Overall, I still give the hotel 5 stars because I really liked it, but please, replace the beds!

Reviews.Title: “You will be charged for everything.”
Reviews.Author: Rawrz
Reviews.Content: So, if you are filthy rich and can afford to pay for every little thing, then this is a great hotel for you, and disregard the rest of my review. If you're not so well off, like me, and think that going to a 4-star hotel would be cool, then read on. First off, make sure you have an extra $200 lying around, because they take it out of your card as soon as you check in. They'll give it all back when you check out, so long as you don't touch anything. The snacks on the table are all horribly over-priced, and they are SENSORED. So you will get charged if you pick them up for too long. There is also a $25 fee for removing said items if you would prefer to get rid of the possibility of accidentally doing anything to them. Wireless internet is $10 a day, but you can use the computers in the Studio for free. If you need a microwave, call in for it in advance, or you probably won't get it. There is also no mini-fridge. You might be able to use the private mini-bar, probably for a fee. If you need silverware, bring it with you. You will get charged for room service to bring you anything, even silverware. Parking is $55 a night. There are no inputs on ANY of the TVs. If you want to play video games or watch your own movies, you have to use the Studio. The Studio is on the sixth floor; it is a video game room that is the only free and complimentary thing in the entire hotel. It's supposed to open at 4 PM, but each of the three nights of my stay we had to call in to make them open it. I was scared to use the soap at this hotel for fear there would be a charge, so I can't confirm if the stuff in the bathroom was complimentary or not. Didn't want to chance it. Putting all of the absolutely ridiculous charges aside, the room was nice. The beds were really comfortable, though the mattress pad often came off and had to be readjusted. The decor was interesting and different, the large shower head was nice, etc. My friends and I had two double-bed rooms that were totally different. My room was very small and had a tiny pedestal sink in the bathroom, while their room had an extra chair, almost double the floor space, and a large marble sink in the bathroom. So if you do want to go here, try to be specific about what kind of room you want.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Priceline or other "discount" that results in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a result of a Priceline search for 4-5 star in downtown Chicago. Admittedly, I started my bidding at a low $100 but have done this several times with success in the past when booking the same day as a stay. I had never heard of the Sax before but realized that it's taken the place of the House of Blues so I knew the location and was anxious to explore. Upon check in I requested that we be given a room with two beds or a pullout couch (sharing the room with a friend and her daughter) and was told that there would be a $40 "upgrade" charge to do so. When did two beds instead of one king become an upgrade? I got the sense that no matter what I'd requested would include an upgrade charge. So be it. The room was spacious and the shower had a fabulous large head with great pressure. The linens were soft and clean, which is expected at a 4-5 star, but the beds were very limp and both had deep sinkholes in the middle. After a long day of photoshooting for my friend's daughter, we returned to the room at 8-ish starving but too tired to go out so we ordered soup and salads from room service. What a mistake! With so many great restaurants around this hotel we choked down stale bread, a poor excuse for a salad and "homemade" soup that tasted like it came out of the river nearby. This was the worst food I've eaten since dorm food! 3 small salads and one bowl of awful soup for $65! But wait, there's more! When we parked my car at the front of the hotel (only parking available at this hotel) we were given a ticket as per usual. The next morning we came down to depart the hotel, gave the bellman our ticket and after a long wait, discovered that they'd misplaced my car. Actually, what happened is the attendant the night before had given me the wrong stub and it didn't match my car ticket. So...after a 20 minute wait my car was pulled out front and we were charged...ready for this??...$55 for one night of parking at a hotel where we had stayed! I almost fainted! IMO, this hotel has worked the hotel discount websites to to their favor by accepting a low bid on a room only to "a la carte" their way back to their original fee. I abhor dishonesty like this.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Explorer071
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel booking through priceline at $140 per night. At the time we felt it was a fair deal for a 4 star hotel. Then we started reading online reviews which were largely negative regarding the amenities at the hotel. To our dismay when we got into our room it was like we had stepped into a 2 star hotel. The room lacked any frills or glamour. The decor was dated and the sheets were faded. There was absolutely nothing glamourous about the room, which begged the question of why it is rated as a 4 star hotel. The mattresses were lumpy, there is no pool and the internet is not free! The breakfast was meagre and expensive. We only ordered room service once and ate out throughout our one week stay. Also the rooms are not cleaned thoroughly by the housekeeping. They actually did not change teh sheets even when there were food stains, and just covered the stained sheets with the blanket. It was an absolute waste of money for us. We have stayed in 3 star hotels at $100 a night (through Priceline) that had more luxury that the Sax. I think the star rating of this hotel should be reduced as it is a deception to intending users. We were travelling with children and the hotel had absolutely no child friendly amenities

Reviews.Title: “Sax Hotel, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: wooploaf23
Reviews.Content: Recently went to Chicago for a 3 night getaway. Found the Sax Hotel about a week before heading to Chicago on hotels.com for $129/night + complimentary parking (parking is usually $47/night, so this was HUGE!) We arrived on a Sunday morning, approx 4 hrs before check-in. The staff was very nice and accommodating and held our bags and the valet parked the car. We started touring the city right away and the hotel is only about 2-3 short blocks from Michigan Ave. The hotel is located right next to the House of Blues and on the same block as Harey Carey's! I cannot say enough about the location, it was in the middle of everything. We never took our car out of the garage! No need to! The rooms were amazing! The view was not so good, but it didn't matter, we didn't plan on it, nor did we need it! The rooms (we had a kind room) was extremely clean and spacious! Cool decor, very different! We went to Wrigley Field for a Cubs game and the "El" station is 2 blocks from the hotel (only $9 roundtrip for the El.) If I ever return to Chicago, I will try my hardest to stay at the Sax Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent city option”
Reviews.Author: ajorge38
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly decent boutique hotel trying a little too much to be cool. Besides the overdone decor, the rooms are comfortable and spacious with better than expected amenities. Excellent rainforest showers in a huge bathroom that comes with decent toiletries and plush towels and robes. The room itself has an extremely comfy bed and is large for city standards. But a 10USD daily charge for wireless usage seems a bit steep in this day and age when internet should really be complimentary. Staff is not particular pleasant albeit very efficient but the hotel does lack in the common areas -- besides the very dark trendy bar there is no common area for guests to sit and lounge in. Location wise, the Sax is a great option! Right next to Marina City honey comb towers, it is in perfect walking distance from the Magnificent Mile and the Loop. A good price/value option for Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for anything more?”
Reviews.Author: Red-E-foradventure
Reviews.Content: Just spent five fabulous nights in the Windy City at Thompson Hotel's Hotel Sax. I had not been to the property since it was the House of Blues Hotel which I really enjoyed. So happy we returned because the hotel is better than ever. The design is is a perfect juxtaposition of funky classic with elegant modern touches. The service is first rate - especially the friendly and knowledgable concierge. Rooms are clean, comfortable and well kept. Can't beat the neighborhood as a jumping off spot for all the great things to do in Chicago, not to mention in the Marina Towers complex itself - The Crimson Lounge, House of Blues, 10 Pin chic bowling spot, Bin 36's wine flights and food pairings, and more, ALL in the hotel or steps away. Also blocks away and a real can't miss - Wendella Boat tours 90 minute architectural river/lake tour - especially if you can get Mallory as your guide. If you're lucky enough to be in town on a Thursday night check out the Art Institute of Chicago's free after hours evening from 5 to 8. docent led tours and wine in the garden - what's not to love?

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Chicago Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cloverd
Reviews.Content: The Sax is by far my favorite Chicago Hotel and one of my favorites anywhere for leisure travel. I go back again and again. Rooms are beautifully designed, with plenty of room to move. Suites are exceptional. Service is great. Staff could not be more professional and attentive. If something is needed or not to your liking, they will remedy it asap. The only thing that keeps the Sax from a higher rating in my mind is the food: average at best, inconsistent and overpriced. My suggestion: room service for breakfast and enjoy some of Chicago's fabulous restaurants for other meals.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel within walking distance of many sights”
Reviews.Author: restless_me
Reviews.Content: Loved: * Huge bathroom * Decor * The fact that you can easily walk to Millennium Park, Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, Hancock Observatory etc. from the hotel * The comfy bed * The look of Crimson, the bar, although we were too tired from sightseeing to give it a try! There were no negatives really, the air con wasn't working properly on our first night but as soon as I reported it to reception it was fixed. Would definitely stay here again if the price was right, the location was so convenient!

Reviews.Title: “A Three Star Hotel at Five Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: JimNielslen
Reviews.Content: Definitely not my taste in decorating - I would call it heroin chic meets a vampire's eclectic garage sale. The halls are extremely dark and unlit. The lighting reminded me of bad, late 1960's Mediterranean motif - dark wood, dark lighting, and dark walls. The room didn't have a theme - every lamp, every piece of furniture, every light bulb was different - nothing matched a style or thought - it was all random. Oh, wait - the room had a running theme of slum bungalow. From the mold and mildew build-up in the bath tub, and the water stains on the ceiling, to the paint that is peeling off the walls, there was a theme of "don't stay here". See the pictures attached. I really enjoyed the fact that there was NO MAID SERVICE during my 48 hours there. There are nicer hotels in the area for a better price.

Reviews.Title: “kind of creepy”
Reviews.Author: DMH50
Reviews.Content: It certainly was a change from the Westin or Hyatt. $40. to upgrade from one to two beds. Mediocre housekeeping . Snooty front desk staff. The one good thing to say about the place was the free computer access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Hotel in City Center”
Reviews.Author: Zelphiakat
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel last minute for one night on priceline. We got in around 10 pm on a thursday and there were lots of you young thin dressed up people pouring out the elevators. It felt like we walked into a club lobby to check in. Check in was smooth and easy, although the decor, doesn't make it obvious this is the function of the room. Elevators had some cool paintings. Hallways had some textured silvery-gray wall paper. Room was beautiful. TONS of mirrors. My guess is the this is a renovated old hotel as the tiles and tub were very 50ish. But the Wallpaper in the bathroom was modern. They should position the towel racks a little better. As your towels are not reachable from the shower. I would say the only downside is the pillows are way too soft. But that is just personal preference. The location could not be better. Restuarants, bowling, drinking all within steps of the hotel. Will cetainly consider this place for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FENTON64
Reviews.Content: The hotel was defintiely unique - it looked like it was from the Adams Family. It was in a good location next to the House of Blues. The parking was pricey - $49 per day; luckily it was included in our rate from Travel Zoo. The hotel staff was very friendly. The hotel was clean and the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Some needed away time”
Reviews.Author: jmconley72
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Chicago for a little for a little get away time. We wanted to stay downtown somewhere to be close to everything. We used Priceline and it hooked us up with Hotel Sax. I didn't know much about it so I checked out the reviews. For the most part the reviews were good so I figured it wasn't too bad a place. All in all the hotel was fine. The decor was a little different that I am used to in a hotel but it did not impact our stay. As soon as we started to our room I did notice that the hallways seemed dark. Again, nothing against the hotel just different that I'm used to. The room was clean and a nice size. I did feel like the room was decorated back in the 70s though. The fake chandelier painted on the wall was weird as was the "snake skin" chair (I don't think it was really snake skin it just looked like it). The large flat panel TV worked well although sometimes a few of the stations would not display. Of the two nights we stayed we only had one issue. On Friday night into Saturday morning our air conditioner smelled like cigarette smoke. It made the room smell really bad so we had to turn it off. Thankfully it wasn't too hot out so we could open the windows. Yes the windows could open. It was kind of neat to be able to open them and hear the downtown world. After falling asleep I woke up somewhere around 12:30am and got up and closed the windows and turned the AC back on (I had enough of the sirens, honking horns, and city noise). Around 3:30am or so my wife got up and turned the AC back off again because the room smelled of cigarette smoke. Once again we opened the windows to the city's serenade. I didn't sleep well the next 3 hours. What capped it was at 7am I woke up to the sound of someone (must have been a porter somewhere) blowing a whistle over and over. We did mention the issue to the front desk but we knew there wasn't much they could do about it. The location of the hotel was great. Walk two or three blocks in any direction and there was plenty to see, do, and eat. If the price is right (which it seemed to be for us) this hotel wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: jsmboca
Reviews.Content: We purchased this hotel via Hotwire - a one night stay (Saturday) King Bedroom for my husband and I. Upon check in at 3:30 pm we entered our room and to our surprise it looked like a hostel from Europe. The sink was in the room - not in the bathroom - no view and the bed was definitely not a king. I called the front desk and told the representative that we needed to change rooms. She proceeded to argue with me and requested I bring "proof" that I purchased a King bed to the reception area. After providing proof - she disappeared for 10 minutes to talk to her manager. She reappeared and indicated that we needed to call the 800 number for Hotwire so they could instruct the hotel that we paid for a King room (eventhough we clearly had proof from the receipt). Long story short - we ended up moving rooms and the second room - albeit larger with a King size bed was not entirely clean, the bathroom was moldy and the celing was cracking. The valet service was terrible - we waited 30 minutes 2 times for our vehicle. We will definitely NOT be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, so far!”
Reviews.Author: Traveleraplenty
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you that I was really nervous coming here because of the things other travlers posted about their experiences. I want you all to remember that some people post negative reviews more often than positive ones. With that said, I will tell you that I am presently staying here, my checkout time isn't until next Thursday. I did book this hotel on Priceline at a good rate. When I checked in, I shared some of my concerns about what I read about this hotel and had a very nice conversation about how if any of those things happened to me, they'd be dealt with. My room is very nice and looks newly renovated. It is clean. The beds are a little lumpy, but comfortable. I did ask for extra pillows because the feather pillows are a little less puffy than my non-feather pillows at home. I was given 2 options to choose from in pillows. The non-feather ones are more my liking. All you have to do is ask if they don't have what you want. The showerhead is huge and the water pressure is very strong. There are alot of snacks in the room that you can buy for a price, but it is just as easy to walk down the street to buy your own. There is an Einstein Bagel across the street and a Starbucks a few blocks away. There are several CVS or Walgreens in close proximity. We ate last night at the House of Blues. Very good and just across the street. Ate lunch at Hard Rock which is about 5 blocks away. The decor reminds me a little of a fancy Haunted Mansion from Disney. Some odd pictures on the walls in the hall and elevator, but they all add to the surroundings nicely. I am fine with this hotel and have no issues. I just wanted to share because I know how nervous I was before coming - but all my fears were really just in vain. So if you are booked and coming soon, don't waste your time worrying about what other people have said, use your time to plan what you're going to do in this city when you get here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Odd Amenities”
Reviews.Author: PinkPeony88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Chicago for the weekend with a few girlfriends (late 20's, early 30's from Boston), and got a great deal on this hotel through Expedia. This place has an amazing location for the price, but the amenities definitely suffered a bit. PROS: Location. Great restaurant BIN 36 attached to the hotel, $100 for breakfast for four girls, but amazing ricotta-blueberry pancakes and pomegranate mimosas in the morning, and also a bright, clean interior. Honestly the best part about this hotel is the bellmen who work at the front door. Nice guys with excellent personalities, found us cabs in less than a minute and were so helpful with directions, suggestions. Chicagoans are very proud of their city and it shows. The Crimson Lounge (attached to hotel, and then see below) for a pre-game drink is a cool place to have a few before deciding where to head out for the night. Sarah, one of the waitresses was really amazing, went through a city nightlife book and recommended a few bars she'd go to her self, and went way out of her way to help us plan our nights out. Housecleaning staff friendly and efficient. CONS: The front desk receptionists are a little robot-y but get the job done. The front desk is like Grandma's Dining Room, crystal glasses on display. I don't know what they are going for here. The Crimson Lounge... ok until 10PM, then it becomes a cheesy, possibly tranny nightclub. I mean, we had to hightail outta there, after a few of the regulars dropped by for the silicone parade of hooker wear. This is all mixed with a few lost and confused tourists wearing fanny packs, jean skirts and white keds who also stopped by for a drink to experience "the city." The rooms... where do I start... black shag carpeting, one mirror and NO ELECTRICAL OUTLETS in the BATHROOM? WTF. We did our hair/makeup sitting on the floor in front of a wall mirror. The mattresses are from 1980 with the original stainings. Pillows are like laying on a tissue. The television sometimes worked. Pretty small rooms with pretty old linens and bare bones hotel soap.
