Major construction going on here so don't look for ambiance at the door. CHICAGO: We're East Coasters. That said, people are slow as $hit in the Mid-West. I literally felt myself pushing them down the street to walk faster. But all in all, super friendly (a little scary for Bostonians) and the city's architecture is breathtaking. Take a river boat cruise (no gasp of fresh sea air here on a lake though). Cabs are unbelievably cheap. There are some gorgeous hotels with nice bars to hit up at night, as downtown Chicago can be a little cheesy. Shopping is excellent. Didn't try the L, but it's NYC like planning makes this an easy city to walk. Speak with someone who lives there because some of the boroughs are like night and day, safety wise. Take a 12$ cab ride out to Wicker Park for some less intense club/bar scenes for casual relaxed places to grab a drink. Nice patio bar at a place called Moonshine, where you can get stiff mixed drinks in a mason jar.

Reviews.Title: “not what I would consider 4 star or the least bit classy”
Reviews.Author: juloscotto
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location but was on top of a night club with a very cheesy class of clientele. Almost scary. Girls wearing clothes that looked like they must have had double sided tape keeping their butt cheeks under their skirts. anyway on to the hotel: It's interior design is like eclectic bordello meets TLC's trading spaces. Very contrived and tongue in cheeky design. The Lobby is all white and red. The hallways are dimly lit with silver lame vinyl damask wallpaper. When you get off the elevator you see a dark wood panel wall with a long credenza and a red mirror and a lonely red telephone. Very staged like some murder mystery meets special victims unit. The room was similarly styled with no lock on the bathroom door which gave it a kind of rape-y vibe. The room was also pretty small. with a fully stocked mini-bar. Patron and grey goose... on top of the dresser. All set for a one night stand after meeting at the club below. Very weird hotel. The towels were dingy and looked like they had been washed and bleached for like 6 years straight. The bathtub had loose poorly replaced tiles with a little mold. not 4 stars maybe three but totally cheesy. Also parking was $50.00 for valet but valet was necessary.

Reviews.Title: “If location is more important than luxury accomodations this is the place”
Reviews.Author: MPX4
Reviews.Content: We come to Chicago a lot for our little get-aways and we usually do Priceline and we usually get the same 3-4 hotesl, so I was surprised when we were awarded Hotel Sax. $90.00 throug Priceline. Below I have listed the Pro's and Con's of our stay. Pro's: The hotel is located right in the heart of everything, shopping, dinning, sightseeing, it is next door to the House of Blues, adjacent to a bowing alley and has a nice resturant and lounge on-site. The lobby is well appointed, upscale anad classy, with a concerige . Front desk quickly upgraded our room when we complained about plaster falling from the ceiling. Our upgraded room was nice size, the bathroom was large (huge actually) and it was pretty clean. The kingsized bed was very comfortable (not the pilliows). Con's: Our first room was smaller than our guest bedroom at home. The queensize bed took up the entire room. The bathroom light was a heat lamp that glowed red - no other light in the bathroom. Directly over the bed plaster was falling from the ceiling from an old leak. The upgraded room had floor to ceiling mirrors, wood paneling and a faux alligator skin wing back chair - icky. The 1960 style dresser with the glass inlay top had visible dirt and other unidentifiable sutff underneth it.. The wallpaper had pictures on chanderliers and other wavy lines on it. The bathroom had green 1970's faux grasspaper wallpaper and floor to ceiling 1/4" cermaic titles - a heat lamp, but luckily one other small lightbulb. The hallways were very dark (poor lighting) with silver shinny wallpaper. Summary: The hotel is managable for one night or if you don't plan on spending much time in the room. I would not pay full price $150 for the two rooms that we were in.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel, great location and fun vibe”
Reviews.Author: Potatopancake
Reviews.Content: Just getting around to writing this review but have been thinking about it a lot lately and thought I should share. I stayed here with friends in 2008 and had a blast. The hotel was beautiful and the staff friendly. The location is great for shopping, tourism and entertainment. The rooms were spacious, clean, welcoming and the bathroom well lit. Little details like hair dryers and irons were available in the room. Simple items, but very important when travelling. We went to the lounge every night and were not disappointed. Despite the large crowd that comes here late night, we managed to get great service and were treated well. It was a blast.

Reviews.Title: “great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: lahianagirl01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sax hotel for two nights and had a great time in Chicago. The rooms were clean but the wall paper was obnoxious and it was peeling off the walls in the bathroom which I found tacky. The location is awesome. Its right next to Harry Carey's and The House of Blues. The service at the hotel was great too. My friend who ended up sleeping on the floor(long story) called the front dest at 0300 in the morning and asked for a blanket and they came up fast with two. The Bed on the other hand was very uncomfortable and lumpy. I did not sleep well due to the quality of the bed. The door men where great and gave us great tips on transportation and where to go for fun. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel peiod. The lobby isn't much...”
Reviews.Author: IceWater_Johnny
Reviews.Content: Great hotel peiod. The lobby isn't much, but my room was amazing. I stayed there on my honeymoon and they upgraded us to a suite for free. Our room was amazing, it had doorbells, cordless phones, 2 bathrooms and panoramic views and anything else you can think of. The materials werehigh end and it made my honeymoon great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel/gracious service”
Reviews.Author: OffWeGo2
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and leisure and have stayed at some truly top hotels. When in Chicago, I usually stay at the Westin Water Tower but as I was traveling to Chicago to attend a concert at the House of Blues, I decided to stay at the Hotel Sax as it is next door to the HOB and I had read the review that the band members often stay there. As a 20th birthday present to my youngest daughter, I bought tickets to see Dashboard Confessional on April 6th at the House of Blues. I booked our room the Saturday beforehand on Expedia.com and received a very favorable rate that included valet parking - a BIG plus for downtown Chicago! Upon our arrival at the hotel, we found that their computer system was down and they were unable to check us in electronically. Absolutely not a problem for them though, as the very gracious front desk manager took our confirmation letter, jotted down my Amex info for incidentials and had the very helpful bellman, Constantine, show us to our room. The room was very sleek and modern. We had paid for a deluxe king but were upgraded to the next class with two doubles. The room was immaculate and the beds were very plush. Constantine offered us tips on the concert venue next door and wished us a pleasant stay. My daughter settled in and then went to the House of Blues to scope out the lay of the land over there. Their staff was extremely helpful and even offered the info that the band would be doing their soundcheck at 2:30 p.m. At that time, the frontman for the band, Chris Carrabba, came in and took some pictures with my daughter and a few other fans who were milling about there. Truly the highlight of her trip! We had to leave the hotel at 4:45 a.m. on the 7th so I could drop my daughter off at Midway for her flight back to her college. We called the bellstand at 4:30 a.m. and when we arrived in the lobby ten minutes later, our car was out front and ready to go. We did not eat in the hotel so I cannot comment on the food but what we saw looked nice. Quick recap - gracious staff, over the top helpfulness; immaculate, well-appointed room; terrific shower and very quiet for downtown Chicago. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: cdanielslp
Reviews.Content: I reserved a spot at this hotel online. It appeared nice and had a reasonable rate to match. The ammenities seemed sufficient and included parking. Upon checking into the hotel, I was informed that I would be charged an additional $49 for parking service. I then had to spend 40 minutes on the phone talking the individual through how I came to find this and helping him view the list of ammenities (which included parking). He realized the mistake and stated that he would credit my account, but that it could take up to 72 hours. The room was nice enough so I had hoped for a pleasant stay from there on out. I was sadly disappointed. The next morning, I heard the housekeeping staff using profanities loudly out in the hallway. I, personally, wouldn't say that I was offended by such behavior, but did have concern for other guests who might have children staying with them. My spouce and I then left for breakfast, came back to retrieve our things, and checked out of the hotel. After waiting approximately 30 mintues for my vehicle to be returned to me, I realized that I had forgotten my cell phone charger in the room. A front desk attendant then escorted me back to the room where I retrieved the charger and left. A couple of days later, I checked my credit card statement to ensure that the parking charge was in fact credited back to my account only to see that it had been, but an additional $200.00 charge was placed by Hotel Sax onto it. I proceeded to call the hotel numerous times and spoke with a very rude woman who answered the phones. I finally was able to speak with a manager and found out that the front desk attendent, who had escorted me to my room, reported that the room smelled of smoke. My spouse or myself DO NOT smoke and we DID NOT smoke in that room. They admitted to not finding any physical evidence of smoking other than saying it smelled like someone could have been smoking in the room. They refused to credit my account and now I am filing a dispute with my credit card company. The irony of the situation was that the attendant NEVER mentioned any concern with me nor was I notified in any way stating that this extra charge would be placed. This hotel is scamming its customers and I am sure that I was not the first to have had this happen, nor will be the last if something does not occur to stop their ability to place random charges on people's credit cards. I am outraged by this situation and truly feel as though I am a victim of a fraudulent crime. Be AWARE of your credit card statement if you decide to stay at this hotel. I can honestly say that I will never be a guest of theirs again nor will anyone I know if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Bed was soooo Comfy”
Reviews.Author: DisneyT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night in the city, in from the burbs. Got it on Priceline for like $60. The hotel had a very cool vibe. Many people on here said the hallways were too dark, but I liked it. The room was very spacious, had lots of windows, and the bathroom was very rooms. Great water pressure in the shower, which I appreciate. My absolute favorite part was the bed. It was like sleeping on clouds. So comfy I can't tell you! I wished I had booked two nights instead of one. I would have much enjoyed sleep in it again. I did not try any of the hotel food service. My impression was most of it was provided my Bin 36, attached to the hotel. The workout facility was fairly small without much equipment, but had what i needed. The staff - take them or leave them. They left no Wow factor. I don't even know if I got greeted when I walked up to the front desk. I had to tell them I was checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lishio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend and enjoyed it very much. The staff are all very friendly...especially the valet guys. We stayed in, what appeared to be a wheelchair accessible room, so we are not sure if the other rooms are described the same way. The room was a very nice size and the bathroom was huge. The decor was posh and contemporary, yet very comfortable, nice and quiet. The bed was comfortable too. The location was great! The restaurant that is attached (Bin 36) looks like a good great place....we only went for desserts at around 10 and it was still packed and the food and wines and cheeses looked great! There's really nothing I can complain about! Would definitely recommend it and would return!

Reviews.Title: “My towel smelled like sour milk”
Reviews.Author: TheBestofTimes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are local Chicago-ans and planned a night out to include a stay at the Hotel Sax Chicago, which is right next door to the House of Blues. The location of the hotel is great! In addition to the House of Blues, it's walking distance to State Street shopping, lots of great restaurants, and the theater district. Since the hotel is so close to these things, there is a younger crowd (20s-30s) and not a lot of children (something to keep in mind if you need a place for your kiddies to play). When you walk into the hotel the lobby, you are confronted with a pretty cool vibe best described as modern baroque design. The room was similar in theme and we had a fabulous view of the river and Marina City. Generally, I would say that the hotel and room were very clean, but some of the chairs in the lobby were getting worn out, which left me underwhelmed. My criticism comes in their execution of the details. We happened to pick up a bottle of wine that was sitting on the mini-bar tray in our room, and just touching created an automatic charge to our room. Since we didn't actually drink the wine, the over-the-top security system for the mini-bar required us to make some calls to straighten out the charges, which was a bit annoying. The bathroom in the room was clean, but the towels smelled really gross (like sour milk) and the in-room soap and shampoo were nothing special. Our room was also freezing cold and turning up the thermostat didn't really help. Overall, it's not a terrible place to stay because of the location, but otherwise a bit over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “bears weekend”
Reviews.Author: jstilts
Reviews.Content: hubby and i took my sister and brother in law to chicago for the weekend for a bears game. we stayed sat/sun and checked out monday. hotel staff was great! and very helpful and friendly. we took right to them, talking sports, rest./clubs, gave excellent directions, flagged down GOOD cab drivers, went over the daily shuttle, and more.. overall, that experience was super! our room on the other hand, was another story.. it was very nice, stocked bar, ect, but the cleanliness left something to be desired. parking was WAY to expensive but the location a big plus. pretty much walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go or was a reasonable cab ride. the house of blues was right next door and harry caray's was 1/2 a block. had an excellent meal at joe's stone crab and a great lunch at Ditka's. was downtown during the Festival of Lights, made to the ESPN Zone and Blues Chicago. overall had a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent staff and rude”
Reviews.Author: jacko_jackson
Reviews.Content: The three of us arrived around 1030 pm to find no help in sight at the front desk. Even in front of the hotel, the employees looked like they felt they were way too cool to work there but at the same time help anyone out. After 5 minutes an attendant came out of the next door club/bar. He barely looked at us and asked for my ID and gave me a key and and room number quickly, although didn't let us know where the elevator was. When we found our room, it had one king size bed. The room was ok (bathroom looked old) and would have probably been fine, except for the fact that it was absolutely not what we needed nor booked. The reservationist confirmed to us specifically over the phone that we would have a deluxe room with 2 queen beds after we told him we no use for a king size bed (as there were 3 of us). Once we got back downstairs to the front desk, it took another 5 minutes to find the attendant. Guess where he was? Bar/club next door. When we told him that we did not reserve a king, he rudely responded that the room is what we booked. We clearly disagreed and let him know we had zero use for a king size bed and to please get us the room we requested and booked. It turns out this character was the night manager and he had zero response. After some poking, he offered a roll away bed. After more questioning on how he was going to accommodate us for their mistake, he basically gave us a rude response and tough luck attitude. We promptly told him to cancel our reservation and walked down to the Rennaisance where the front desk couldn't have been more responsive and helpful. About an hour after being in our room the manager called my cellphone to apologize and offer a suite for a rate of $99 a night. Too little too late. Perhaps it was just night management but would never go back to try it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fashionable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Braziliantraveler7
Reviews.Content: Sax Chicago is a very trendy and well-located hotel. The hotel lobby is mainly non-existent since it is shared by a upscale restaurant, but the staff is very friendly and helpful. The concierge service is great and provided several good tips. The rooms are spacious, very clean and quiet. The House of Blues next door is a good option for dining and entertainment. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kellytherascal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sax in December for my husbands business trip and really enjoyed it. The hotel itself is well decorated and in a great location - close to shopping, restaurants and anything you would need. The rooms are a good size and the bathrooms are nice as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the area. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TanyaA1
Reviews.Content: the hotel is right near the centre of Chicago, next to the river on Dearborne Street. We stayed in the deluxe double room and there was more than enough room for the 2 of us. The hotel bar has good DJ's on most nights, there is a free internet room from 4pm - midnight every day and is right next to the House of Blues.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION is awesome, HOTEL is sexy”
Reviews.Author: JAXtravel
Reviews.Content: This is a really cool Hotel in Chicago, its right in the middle of everything and the price was a deal for how nice this place is. This hotel will not bore you, its charming, exciting, and innovative. I must say, although it is fun and stylish, its not so over the top to the point where it is uncomfortable (like W hotels can be sometimes) this hotel is still cozy and friendly to all people. Stay here in Chicago you will not be disappointed, whoever you are!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Hillaryb0224
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly, rooms are nice with great view of Chicago River and close to House of Blues and Harry Caray's Resaurant, as well, not far from Magnificent Mile. Hallways were dark and elevators a bit scary, but overall great hotel. The bar, Crimson, located in the hotel was not great. The bartenders were nice but the waitresses were like talking to a wall.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with a good rate = good times”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It is "close" on a lot of categories so if you get a good rate you should chose this as a possibility. Here is what close means. The hotel is close to being very good, close to good neighborhood close to having very good service. Would this be the first choice - close but no. It is a pleasant hotel. the rooms are nice. the neighborhood is 3 blocks from nice. Having House of Blues 20 feet away is close to being quiet. Overall I liked the hotel and paid $160 a night and would stay again at that rate or lower. Because the hotel is not great, not great service, not a great heighborhood, not great sound proofing I would not stay at $200. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Miss the House of Blues...”
Reviews.Author: savvystephanie
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Hotel Sax since it was converted from the House of Blues. The vibe is very hip and the location is great, but the room was not up to par with the price we paid. There were major chips in the tub, a burned out light bulb in the bathroom (that wasn't changed in our 4-day stay) and when I went to plug in my laptop, the outlet plate fell off in my hand leaving the outlet completely exposed. There are so many great places to stay in Chicago, we won't be back to the Sax.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice deal, great amenities, not cheap but affordable for the quality”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel86
Reviews.Content: The room was VERY modern and trendy. It had a lot of cool decorations, 32" Plasma TV. High quality minibar, although we didn't touch it because it was a fortune! Be careful though because even if you take something off the minibar it automatically charges you for it (it has these cool sensor pads). We got a pretty good deal, I think about 25% off the room because we went in April (not the busy season). Other pros: -Great Location! Within walking distance to all major attractions -Fun "Game room" with Nintendo Wii, X-Box 360, etc -Right next door the the House of Blues! -Staff was very friendly, although I don't think we had a single problem! -Bathroom had very nice robes, a heating lamp to help you dry off faster and everything was very up to date Cons: -It was almost too trendy for me, even though I'm a fairly "hip" 23 year old! :D -Parking wasn't free, but I don't think it ever is around there. I actually somehow ended up in the employee parking section and only had to pay $10 a day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: consultpsych
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Sax for 1 night while visiting Chicago... Overall a wonderful experience, a stylish boutique hotel. Pros: *Great price due to the economy *$42 parking was included from a deal on expedia.com *Very nice aesthetics throughout the hotel, lobby, rooms, etc. *Rooms were nice and stylish, comfortable beds. Victorian meets Modern. *Right next to the House of Blues, 10-Pin Bowling and Bin 36 *Their own Crimson Lounge is nice, though I'm not big on drinking *Right by Michigan Ave. *Right by Shaws Crabhouse where we had dinner (EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT place to eat) *Interactive entertainment lounge with every current video game system hooked up to LCD/plasma tvs, including a rock band instrument set and BEER available... Cons: *We were given a double room, instead of one with a single bed that I booked (we were tired when we got in so we didn't care... I'm sure this could have been fixed). *No baths in our standard room, just a shower, in case you cared or wanted to relax and have one. *Kind of dim halls, I didn't know if this was meant for ambience or not. *Interactive game room closes too early (though I'm sure my wife wouldn't want us playing video games on our hotel). *Not much else to say honestly. For an average guy like me, this is a very nice hotel, at a great location, at a good price. I will definitely return here in the future, and recommend it to others, especially if you want to catch a show at the House of Blues right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IowaCityHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: What a surprise. We stayed here through priceline and loved every minute of it. We have been to many Chicago hotels and this one is in the top 5. The room are nicely decorated. The lobby and hallways are awesome as well. The front desk and guest services employees were very nice when we interacted with them. Nothing bad to say about this place. The building itself is old. Our toilet had running water once or twice and the windows could use some fixing but overall can't complain. We tried Bin 36 and A Mano and both are good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Funky decor, and fab services”
Reviews.Author: shumate
Reviews.Content: The hotel sax was a wonderful treat. I had seen mixed reviews before going, but really enjoyed my stay. Since I was driving, the hotels.com free parking offer tipped the scales for me. I arrived early (10am) and they were able to let me check in early. The location is central. The room has some unusual decor, but the bed was comfy. The free internet was also a nice plus. The gym was small, but offered enough for me. If I have another conference on this side of Chicago, I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Sexy Downtown Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkv999
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was outstanding. The service was beyond my expectations - the bellman took great care of our car, helped us get taxis, gave directions and even remembered our names during our whole stay. The room, although small was lovely with a window that could be opened and a fabulous bed. The whole hotel was very swanky and sophisticated. We didn't try the bar inside the hotel but there was a great steakhouse just across the parking lot, who served up steak and lobster at 11pm after a Cubs game. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Eclectic”
Reviews.Author: Normac13
Reviews.Content: Just visited Chicago and stayed at the Sax Hotel by a friend's referral. I'm from California, so I welcomed the "swanky" feel of this hotel. When you walk into the lobby, it is very modern with lounge music playing and a smell of incense in the background. The staff is very young and chic, they probably hire models for this hotel. LOL One of the floors has a business center with wall size flat panels, laptops and gaming consoles. I thought the gaming consoles were a little strange, I guess they cater to a younger clientele. Nonetheless, very chic and the Chicagoans fit right in to make this an interesting place to network even if it's just to check your email. The rooms have snake skinned chairs, 70's looking beds (that are huge), and a small radio that also looks like it was from the 70's. Turn it on though, and it's a blazing Bose system that will rock your room! Mini Bar has the cutest bottles of Patron Tequila, I thought that was a nice touch....At night, visit the Crimson Lounge downstairs. Great music with lots of nooks to hang out with friends. You need to be dressed pretty hip to mingle in that crowd! Lots of fun, loved it. Across the parking area outside is the house of blues. If you stay at Sax you get to visit for free. You also get to visit the private foundation room at HB, pretty neat place, make sure you book it through the concierge in advance, otherwise, they won't let you in! Just around the corner are some fantastic european style restaurants. Very good and healthy. Walk down the riverwalk and there are great steakhouses and Dick's last resort. I hope you visit, I loved it! Oh and each room has an X-box! I thought that was weird, but I thought I'd mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service - Parking Rate HIGH”
Reviews.Author: rkalish12
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night at Hotel Sax and had a great experience. The rooms are large, well furnished and chic. The bathroom is very large, well lit and a had great shower head. The fitness center is up to date and had a lot of space in it. Hotel Sax is is a pretty trendy place as it's adjacent to the House of Blues. It's right in the heart of great restaurants, theaters, shopping and other attractions. The service was excellent too. My only complaint was the parking charge ... $49 for overnight! I'd definitely stay there again but will either take public transportation or park down the street at less than half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Unique (think swanky) decor, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: chrisnalison
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into Hotel Sax on the Friday night of Labor Day weekend. We had booked the room on Priceline, and check-in was effortless. The dramatic, red lobby set the tone for the hotel--very dim, moody lighting. The assortment of live betta fish inhabiting glass vessels under the front desk were a nice touch, as were the Hot Tamales free for the taking. Upon checking into the room, we loved the decor. Bathrooms might be a little dated (maybe not entirely redone when conversion took place), but are very generously-sized. The guest rooms are also roomy, and the bedding is comfortoble. I loved the chandelier decal on the wall (not to mention the varied wallpaper patterns--some metallic--throughout the hotel). Really, life just feels more glamorous while sitting in a faux snake skin upholstered chaise louge. We had a nice Some might find that sort of thing tacky, but maybe they should lighten up a little. Hehe. Crimson (the hotel bar/lounge) was beautiful--we found a comfy couch on the Sunday night of our stay and the mood was very relaxed, music was just right. We walked into the "Technology Experience" room and it was an interesting idea, but we didn't stay long. Really, I can't think of a single complaint. The view was good, the location was great, and the hotel itself was like any other. One caveat, valet parking is $49 a day.

Reviews.Title: “another visit to the Sax...and it didn't dissapoint!”
Reviews.Author: lisathew8lifter
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth annual visit to Hotel Sax and although I have reviewed it before, I feel compelled to do so again. We booked our trip on travelocity and it was extremely reasonable to fly and stay over Labor day weekend. as always, the concierge, front desk, and the bell men were helpful and friendly. We stayed on the 10th floor in a room with a king bed. The room was clean, spacious and the bed was comfortable. The only complaint is that the bathroom sink was tiny and there was no room to set anything on top of it without it falling in the sink or on the floor. The maid service was slow but i would imagine they were full for the long weekend. we had wine and cheese purchased from Bin36 in our room during two nights of our stay and it was awesome. the people are friendly, helpful, and quick in getting you your order to go. we had never done this before and will definitely do it again next year. the hotel is close to everything and is in a great location. for breakfast, there are many options since room service is expensive (starbucks, einstein bagel accross the street, and the huge mcdonalds down the road). i love the hotel sax!

Reviews.Title: “great spot for romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: burksfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did our first anniversary in chicago and stayed at Sax. The rooms were very nice, and the location was great. Very close to train that made the rest of the city readily accessible. Also w/in walking distance of lots of cool shops, restaurants, etc. The staff was very helpful with directions and maps for getting around a city we were completely unfamiliar with.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: missymaeGrandRapids
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the view. When we arrived it took about 15 minutes to get a valet to even recognize us and give us a ticket for the car. The room was ready early and they let us check in about an hour before the standard check in time. Our room was disappointing, except for the view. The headboard was practically falling off the wall, and the nightstand was actually leaning against the wall, not attached to anything. All the staff we came in contact with after the valet were more than helpful and accommodating, especially the bellhop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great room”
Reviews.Author: kcwn76
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Sax and everything was better than expected. Room was big, clean and modern. The bathroom was huge, a big plus for my wife. Elevators were fast, staff was exceptionally helpful, just a very pleasant stay. The location could not have been better, close to Michigan Ave., within walking distance of great bars and restaurants. Really can not figure out why this Hotel is rated this low. Need to check your statement on departure had some problems, but hotel made adjustments. Other reviewers had this problem too. Again, I would stay on next visit to Chicago and cannot understand why hotel is rated so low.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful about checkout charges”
Reviews.Author: 4travelers98
Reviews.Content: We purchased our room for 2 nights through Priceline. We had printed our confirmation and brought it with us. Our last night we got the bill from the hotel under the door for about $300 for "promotional room rate" We questioned this charge and were told that we had only purchased one night through priceline. I had called our credit card and we indeed had purchased 2 nights. We took our print out of confirmation for the 2 nights we already paid to the front desk and the initially removed the charge. HOWEVER, when I received our credit card bill about 2 weeks later, there was a charge of $190 (besides the $80 charge for housing our car for 2 nights) I called to talk to the manager and she said that "they investigated it and we had only purchased 1 night," so they charged us after we left on our credit card for $190. I said oh no, we had purchased 2 nights and showed the front desk clerk our receipt. She asked for the confirmation email to prove this (from priceline) Long story short, it took me awhile to convince this manager that we had paid for 2 nights through priceline. She made me feel like we were trying to fraud the hotel. We originally had a good experience with the hotel, but ended up on a VERY sour note. And through all this the manager never offered anything for the headache she put us through.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE ,GREAT DEAL, Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: earthelements2000
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after booking b/c of the mixed reviews I had read, but the location was perfect and they had an INCREDIBLE package deal... "the Windy City package". For $203 a night, we stayed in a superior king room, a $50 gift certificate to any of the hotel restaurants, PLUS valet parking ($42 per day) was included. Couldn't beat that price.(We stayed Thursday through Saturday night... the deal isn't weekend exclusive like some!) Book through the hotel site for the deal (I think it's offered through Dec 2009). It's not available throught the "bargain bookers' sites". The lobby of Hotel Sax was beautiful. All of the hotel staff members were incredibly helpful, kind, and considerate. I had read complaints in some reviews about the dark hallways...they aren't neon if that's the issue. The wallpaper is a patterned silver and has a nice reflective quality... yes the wood is dark, but I never had problems seeing.The superior king room was plenty big with comfy beds & clean and ample bathrooms.Of course the mini bars are expensive, as some have complained. Stop at the 7 eleven down the street and grab snacks. We're not room service people either (really, who is in Chicago???)...too much to see and do. The shower is a small tub (about half of the conventional size tub. If you are looking to soak, then you probably won't be happy. Absolutely NO complaints here. The room was exactly as it appeared on the hotel website. The hotel was quiet, even with the clubs downstairs. We were on the 11th floor and couldn't hear any of the noise. We had a great meal at Harry Caray's and lunch at Bin36 on the hotel. The hummus at Bin was great... but the service was slow. We went right at opening for lunch though. The Crimson Room seems like a hopping place, but my husband and I aren't into the club scene. We found the hotel to be convenient to walk almost everywhere. It doesn't have that "chain hotel feel", and that's what we loved about it. No coffee maker in the room, but they serve Intelligentia coffee in the lobby in the morning, and it was excellent. Loved Hotel Sax!! *** Architectural Boat Tour our of Ogden Slip was great, as well as the night shoreline cruise for viewing the fireworks at Navy Pier on Saturday night (summer). If you love Chicago style pizza, check out Giordanno's... also recomment Portillo's on Ohio for great sandwiches..

Reviews.Title: “We loved our first visit”
Reviews.Author: mspurple55
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to Chicago for our 12th anniversary. After studying and agonizing over all the hotel choices online - I booked us at Hotel Sax through Expedia. We got good enough rates. The hotel was all we needed - good location, close to public transportation, nice friendly helpful staff, our room was CLEAN, the decor somewhat eclectic - but if you want the same old hotel - stay at one of the major chains. We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 day trip! Nice comfy robes, good quick room service - FANTASTIC shower, nice toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get reserved room type and room dirty!”
Reviews.Author: claw7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotels.com and prepaid for a Superior King room. When we checked in and got to our room, the room was small and the bed looked like full size. I called the front desk takled to the manager. She said that unfortunately when you book through a third party vendor such as Expedia or Hotels.com, they cannot guarantee the room type and that they were sold out for the night. I asked if we could get a discount and she said no. I indicated that our view was a view of the parking garage and she said that most all rooms have a view of the parking garage. The hotel room was small and when I walked around barefoot, someone's hair pin stuck to the bottom of my foot along with hair. The bathroom just had a shower stall, no bathtub. The halls were super dark and gloomy. There are no vending amenities at the hotel to buy bottled water, soda etc. I do not recommend this hotel and will be staying somewhere else for our next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “No longer worth it!”
Reviews.Author: CatherineMI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend a few weekends a year in Chicago and loved this hotel when it was the House of Blues. After our stay this weekend, we were very disappointed. We reserved a king room and were given an incredibly small, dark room with a queen bed. When we spoke to guest services to change to a room that met the reservation expectations, we were not treated very well. They were not willing/able to honor what we booked and did not seem to think it was a problem. The room lighting was so dim, I was not able to see to apply make up once the sun had set. The wall behind the bed had a section that was falling off and the overall look was pretty shabby. This was not at all what we had experienced during previous visits to the House of Blues. Friends of ours stayed in a hotel nearby. They had a fabulous room (spacious and well-lit too!) and were treated very well. While we look forward to our next wonderful visit to the Windy City, we won't make the mistake of booking a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, hip, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nyctravis
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Small enough for a boutique feel but large enough to provide some of those amenities that are nice to have from the big hotels, such as wireless internet (free), gym, room service, etc. The hotel decor was really cool and hip and personally, I really appreciated the change from sterility from other hotels. Not everyone may like it, but I found it to be a welcome change. Room was clean and well kept, with a big flat screen tv, nice alarm clock/radio that you can plug your iPod into (with an adapter cable), and a nice big bathroom. Had a great view of the Chicago River. Only downsides were the lack of a coffee maker in the room (although they had free coffee in the lobby in the morning), and there wasn't much in the way of being able to store your clothes and travel items. The in-room bar seemed a bit overprioritized and over-priced and may have come a bit at the expense of being able to offer a bureau to store clothes, but it was a minor thing. Bed nice and comfy with really soft sheets. Free wireless internet was a nice touch and made me feel like I wasn't being competely nickel and dimed. Location could hardly be beat. Warning: at night the place is hopping so be prepared for that and consider staying elsewhere if this might bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Smelled Like Rot, Personal Items Stolen”
Reviews.Author: captjohn1958
Reviews.Content: Decor on the rock-star side of things - interesting to look at but not to live with for 3 days. The hallways were too dark to navigate with anything more than your room key - not the case when you're there on business. The bed was comfy. The shower did not drain well; not unusual. The hallways smell in the mornings of stagnant water - which didn't help our enjoyment of breakfast in the hotel restaurant. And the stolen items - that's where 'value' and 'service' take the downgraded rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: palcol
Reviews.Content: Good standard of Hotel, right on the river walk in the centre of Chicago. Rooms were adequate size and clean. view from room was ok,large windows allow a lot of light in and made the room very airy. Staff V helpfull. Would recommend as prices were good also. Dont eat in the restaraunt it was very over priced and the standard of food awful!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Trendy, Sophisticated ... Not so Clean”
Reviews.Author: ndjourneygirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sax is exceptionally located in the River North area of downtown Chicago, ideal for concertgoers of the House of Blues Chicago, and within easy walking distance from Michigan Avenue shopping, many restaurants, and activities within The Loop. Our room had divine views of the Chicago River. The hotel lobby and bar are luxuriously decorated in a sophisticated yet modern vintage decor, appealing to the eye. We loved the decor of our room, too -- very different from standard hotel decor, trendy and fun. Unfortunately, the service was substandard. We only stayed one evening and we know Chicago fairly well, so this was not a problem for us; however, we experience much better service in other hotels in the area. The bathroom needed a more thorough cleaning, and there was crud stuck to the wallpaper. These aren't major inconveniences, but certainly soured our experienced for what was reported to be a five-star hotel. I recommend staying at a discount -- we found our room for half the normal rate -- or looking elsewhere in the area. If you like cozy and comfy with coffee in the morning, this is not the hotel for you. If you're edgy and require little by way of service, check it out. Overall, it's a cool hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Trying to Please”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel which has been recently renovated in a funky style. Relatively small rooms and bathrooms, but nicely done. Good toiletries. Pros: Location in Marina City, close to River North resto's. Great concierge (Catherine) and door-staff. Housekeeping delivered an extra pillow 5 minutes after requested. Coffee/tea in lobby on weekday mornings. Comfy linens and bathrobes. Flat-screen TV. Technology lounge with X-Box, Wii, Guitar hero. 3 computers in the lobby for free. Good deals (incl. parking) on Travelzoo. Entire staff is super helpful, friendly, very knowledgeable--if they didn't know an answer, they'd check it on the internet for us. Free wireless in rooms. Cons: Small rooms. No coffee/tea maker in rooms. No coffee/tea in lobby on weekends. Bathroom had no room for personal washkits/cosmetics. Dresser top full of for-purchase drinks & snacks, leaving little room for personal storage. No makeup mirror. View of the parking deck at Marina City. Dark, dark hallways (may be this is hip?) Our room key was shut off at 3pm, a day before our scheduled departure. Our "free parking" showed up on our bill at $42/day. Overall: would stay there again if I got a great rate, parking included. Otherwise, I'd head to the Amalfi for larger rooms, free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent....!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandSarah
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Chicago and we chose Hotel Sax after reading reviews on tripadvisor. It's near the river and there's lots of restaurants and bars in the local area. All of the main attractions and things to do are within reasonable walking distance. It's not cheap but we booked through hotels.co.uk which meant we got a good deal so it was more reasonable. The bar at the hotel - The Crimson Lounge - is really classy and livens up later in the night. The restaurant does a really good brekkie in a relaxed atmosphere, and the evening menu looked nice, although we didn't get to try it out. It's an eclectic type hotel with quite dramatic decor - rooms are lovely and it's really quiet so you can get a good lie in ! We got a room upgrade and the room had a nice view of the river, was spacious and had a well appointed bathroom. The mini bar was expensive though ! The staff at the hotel were very accommodating - both before we arrived and whilst we were there - making reservations and recommendations. They arranged an airport transfer for us too. I would certainly recommend this hotel for a leisurely stay in the fab city of Chicago !

Reviews.Title: “Funky Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kaseysmom
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for three nights to visit our son who was moving into his first apartment in the city. We picked the Hotel Sax because of the proximity to our sonâ€™s apartment, but turns out to be a great location in the city for many reasons (restaurants, shopping, historical sites, etc.). Our room was a Deluxe King overlooking the â€œcorn cobâ€� building and the river. Loved the funky dÃ©cor of the room. Bed was very comfortable, nice linens. The bathroom was also well decoratedâ€¦modern, cool chic. Overall, very nice room â€“ clean, comfortable and updated. We are not the types to stay up late (we used to be!!) but if you want entertainment there is plenty right in the complex with the hotel (Crimson Lounge, House of Blues, Bin36, even Dickâ€™s Last Resort). Given our sons new address in Chicago, we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but bring your own quality Toilet Paper!”
Reviews.Author: vegasflys
Reviews.Content: I decided to play the Priceline.com Hotel Roulette game and landed Hotel Sax for a three night stay. I was a little nervous since I've never heard of the place. But when I arrived from Midway airport via the Orange Line, I was happy to find the place was clean, classy, and a great location. It's about a two block walk from any color Rail line you want. However parking rates are insane! $42 a night? Give me a break. Does that insane rate come with a full Wash and Hand wax? I would recommend not renting a car and using the CTA Trains. As for the staff, They were great. I kindly asked them for a River View and they gave me a great room! No room has the "Perfect View" but the staff upgraded me without a charge! In the room, Loved the bed, the bathroom, and the HD Television with a big selection of channels. On the down side, The Maid forgot to put toilet paper in my room one night and didn't replace the glass cups I used. Rip off warning!!! The mini bar prices are crazy. On top of that, they add 10.5% Chicago ultra high sales tax! Hotel Sax, Just make it a flat rate for us poor tourist! My other picky issue .... Hotel Sax needs to offer better quality Toilet Paper of all things! Yes Picky but for a upscale hotel, The Toilet Paper in the room reminded me of a public Restroom. Just bring Northern T.P. from home and your all set! (grin)

Reviews.Title: “Weird vibes!!!”
Reviews.Author: SimonBow
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave us weird vibes. I like cutting edge, modern hotels but this one was just a little strange. Our room was decorated like a pied-a-terre owned by Liberace: Crazy wallpaper and furniture, and an ink blot chandelier painted on the wallpaper. Very strange. The staff cleaned it well and the bed was comfortable. Internet was free which was very nice, but the check in people knew little: they had a hard time giving us directions and telling us anything about Chicago. Additionally, the "workout facilities" (if you could call them that) were little more than a storage room in the basement of the hotel with 2 treadmills and 2 elliptical trainers. Very lame! The location is very good: right next to house of blues, Marina City, Magnificent mile, you name it! Being centrally located was great. But overall, we enjoyed the more classic, comfortable Intercontinental more. Overall this hotel is ok. It may be the perfect place for you if you enjoy trendy modern stuff. There is also one of the hottest hotel bars in Chicago attached to it. Although this bar gave us weird vibes too as it is a mix of young girls being hit on by sketchy older male hotel guests. Also beware, hotel can be loud as the walls are thin and this bar is loud. We had several bar patrons staying in rooms on our floor and they kept us up almost all night long!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT worth it. Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: ACKACK1313
Reviews.Content: Here is an absolutely unbiased review: I was there for a National meeting, and stayed here even though the meeting was at McCormick place. I stayed in room 1014. It is really dark and depressing in the room, and musty and dirty as well. The bed was way too short for me (i'm 5'11...not a giant), and when you sleep on the bed the bottom sheet comes undone immediately and isn't really fitted, and the comforter is cheap, not a nice down one. There's some dirty, cheap, leather pillows on the bed. The room is not well lit, uncomfortable, and the bathroom is cold and not clean. An old pack of Rolaids was stuck in the corner of the room (if the hotel reads these: CLEAN THESE UP!). It was a total of $300 a night... so overall, it was terrible. There are many, many better hotels that are actually much cheaper. Don't stay here, pick somewhere else. I spend much less in a Westin ---I left to stay here I was so sick of the SAX, and even though I don't think Westin's are that great, it was at least comfortable, with decent beds and shower. The SAX was cheap, dirty, cold, and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times At The SAX!!!”
Reviews.Author: BOHSMAN
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Sax primarily because of the positive reviews on this site. Check-in was prompt, efficient, etc., rooms fairly spacious and clean. Only complaint would be a lack of storage - the hotel's website claims that a double double room sleeps 4 comfortably which is true but if they got rid of the outrageously overpriced mini-bar ( we did'nt indulge!! ) this would create more room. Only other issue of note was noise from a party in the room next to ours at 3.00am!!! which, when we rang reception to inform them of same, resulted in no action being taken as the noise continued for a number of hours. In fairness to the hotel they compensated us adequetly when we mentioned it the following morning. We had our 2 daughters with us ( 11 and 8 ) so could'nt make use of The CRIMSON LOUNGE but it looked like a food place to go. On an extremely positive note, my daughter's teddy bear was accidently caught up in the sheets and disappeared off to the laundry company, and after quite a number of phone calls both were reunited after approx 36 stresssful hours!!!! Hats off to all in housekeeping, front desk and even the bell boys for a great job. Checked out the STUDIO and it was a popular place to hang out. BIN 36 is also good for breakfast, evening drinks etc., We engaged the services of Katherine, the concierege who got us a 50% discount in tickets for the BULLS at the United Centre so all in all, we would use the hotel again. 3 internet ports in the lobby proved very useful also.

Reviews.Title: “Great sax!”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: The Sax was just perfect for us. We got a fantastic deal through travelzoo for $109 which included free parking and two drinks at the bar. Checked in early and requested a Chicago River view, which was awesome, we got to watch the river turn green from the comfort of our room! The staff across the board could not have been more helpful. Our room, while not huge was comfortable, clean and well appointed. It was so great to walk next door at night and catch a show at The House of Blues too! The hotel bar was swank, comfortable and the staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my room”
Reviews.Author: LizonMorton
Reviews.Content: I LOVED the Hotel Sax! I stayed here for 3 nights for a business trip, and spent most of it in the hotel because of my meetings and the bad weather outside. My 14th floor room was large with a nice view of the Chicago River. It had a very comfortable beds, fluffy towels, nice bathrobes, and great toiletries. It was silent in my room -- I couldn't hear people in the hallways, the TV next door, or the traffic outside. And despite being on the 14th floor the elevators came very quickly. Good wireless connections, and free Internet access with printers in the lobby so you can print out boarding passes and the like. One minor complaint - The room is lit by about 6 lamps, so to get the lighting level I wanted I had to walk around the room and turn them all on. My only complaint about value is the fees tacked onto the room service bill -- I order a $9 salad and $11 pizza, and got a $36 bill. They also have the snacks and mini-bar drinks on some sort of touch-sensitive tray so that they know when you touch them, which is a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Palmer House or Drake when I am in Chicago, but opted for this little gem because they had a special of $109. with free parking which in Chicago is worth $40 a day. Check-in was a breeze, front desk staff and and everyone I came in contact with was super. Room was a little small (1526) but nicely furnished; large plasma TV on wall very nice. Quiet area, good dinner choices within a block. Easy CTA (bus) service into the loop. They also gave me two drink coupons which I used in the Crimson Lounge which is a large nicely furnished bar area. Free internet terminals are available in the lobby. Workout room was okay, three treadmills, three elipticals and some free weights. Two televisions mounted on the wall, no headphone jacks. I was the only one working out so it wasn't an issue. Definitely somewhere I would consider again. For weekend visitors parking on the street is free after 6 p.m. on Saturday all day Sunday until 8:00 a.m. Monday. I had no trouble finding street parking if you don't get free parking in your rate. Cheers. Marius

Reviews.Title: “Great little Gem with a GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: tanya4
Reviews.Content: Booked our room via Priceline and was overall a great experience/choice. Can not say enough about the location - close walking all River North, Michigan Ave, Loop. Great decor - a little unual and modern. Very comfy bed, with robes, slippers and a VERY expensive mini bar! Since we booked via Priceline, I knew that we get a room for 2, usually a King. So, I emailed the hotel and received a wonderful response stating that our reservation had been changed to a double to accomodate our 4 year old. Well - that didn't happen! The gal at the counter was pretty much - take it or leave it, we're sold out! Liked 10-pin next door, and found cheap (for chicago standards) parking at the Sterling Lot 1 block away. The lounge in the hotel, Crimson, was pretty swank and crowded after 10:00. Nice and not overly priced. Overall, I give it 4 stars, as there are way better hotels in Chicago that get 5! I would definitely stay here again! Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Am2480
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 2 nights at this hotel through Hotwire for our anniversary and were pleasantly surprised. The customer service was friendly and helpful from the beginning. When we first walked into our room with queen bed, I truly loved the decor (online pics don't do it justice), but was disappointed that there was only a shower stall with no bathtub - I am 6 months pregnant and was completely in need of a good soak! My husband called the front desk and requested an upgrade - they moved us into a larger room with bathtub, king bed, and even a better view - all at no extra charge. We had a couple of maintenance requests during our stay and the staff continued to be friendly and helpful, resolving all issues within a matter of minutes. Valet service was also great although a bit expensive (but it's the only 24-hr parking nearby that allows unlimited in-and-out privileges in case you do need to drive somewhere). The Microsoft Room (game room) was a great bonus - my husband loved it! Also, the little extras in the room were a nice added touch (i.e. bathrobes, safe, plush bed/pillows) My only recommendation is to read the hotel guide as soon as you enter your room to know what additional charges you may incur during your visit - from things like making local phone calls to consuming the tempting snacks on the desk/bar area. Also, call around for reservations for area restaurants, since many do not take walk-ins. Overall this was a great hotel that we would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mcboat209
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via priceline for $130 per night. Overall, it was a great experience. Location is great -- hotel is located next door to Harry Carry's and the House of Blues. Many other restaurants and shops are within several blocks. Positives: Unique Decor -- not your typical cookie-cutter hotel; Quiet sleeping rooms; flat screen televisions; nice bedding & ambience; extremely helpful staff -- bellhops & concierge were great! Negatives: Very limited room service menu; It would have been nice for the basic mini bar items to be available at a lower cost (i.e. $8 bottled water; $5 cans of soda). We would definitely consider staying here again on our next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Speak up!”
Reviews.Author: bainso
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location in 2006 when it was The House of Blues. We liked the area so decided to book a King room at the recently renovated Hotel Sax. We requested early check-in & got a room right away. We were told that only a Queen room was available. When we got to the room on the 6th floor we were extremely disappointed...the bathroom was so tiny that the sink was in the bedroom area & that area was also very small. I called the desk to complain & the receptionist said "you booked through Expedia" then said she could give us a room with 2 double beds...I immediately said yes since we wanted out of that tiny room. The 2nd room was much bigger & had a nice flat-screen TV. I had requested a fridge & asked if there was a coffee maker in the room & was told no, but they would send one up. She also mentioned a microwave & I asked what the charges would be. She said there was no charge & sent the items up. There were floor to ceiling windows that opened. The view was of the unique condo/parking towers & The House of Blues which is very busy every night of the week, but being on the 11th floor the noise was minimal. They provide in-room safe, iron/board, bathrobes, mini bar, nice toiletries & power rain shower that feels like a massage. The Crimson Lounge on the main floor is very popular, lively & quite expensive. Bin 36 is right next door as well as 10 Pin Bowling Alley & Lounge. Harry Caray's Bar & Restaurant is nearby. Boat tours are also close by. We took the River Tour on Chicago's First Lady which has volunteers from the Chicago Architecture Foundation who are extremely knowledgeable. Hints: Go to Shaw's Crab House, 21 E. Hubbard St. for half price oysters 4 to 6 pm. Check out the free days for the Shedd Aquarium. Lincoln Park Zoo is always free. Take the #22 bus at the stop just around the corner from the hotel. There is also a free shuttle to Navy Pier...great burgers at Charlie's Ale House!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: LuvPugs30
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Sax and we had a great experience. We got a fantastic steal on it through Priceline and we were worried at first after reading the mixed reviews here. Yes, its not your typical boringly decorated hotel...its fun and hip. I thought the room itself was beautifully designed and the entire hotel has a cool vibe to it. The Microsoft studio was a lot of fun and completely different than any other hotel lounge. In addition, I loved having the free use of computers in the lobby, as well as in the Studio to check maps and restaurant menus. The concierge was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. She recommended a restaurant about 2 blocks away - Vermilion - that was amazing. We would have never chose this restaurant on our own, but it was probably one of the best meals we've ever had. Oh, and the blueberry ricotta pancakes at Bin 36 in the hotel are totally worth the price!! This is a great place to stay in downtown Chicago--close to everything and completely safe.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sax - Funky & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Nic6191974
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Sax from August 14th - 17t h and enjoyed my stay very much. I had stayed here 3 years prior when it was the House of Blues and appreciated the redecorated rooms. I felt like i was staying in a gingerbread house when it was the House of Blues. Check in was super quick and friendly. Benjamin was the bellman who brought our bags to the room and he was not only friendly but was quite knowledgeable about the happenings in Chicago that weekend. In the lobby, they had a small table set up with a water pitcher for a refreshing glass of lemon water one day and cucumber infused water the next. Nice touch. All in all, we enjoyed our stay very much and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sax was okay”
Reviews.Author: mo1279
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel sax for 2 nights in August. I have mixed opinions about the hotel. While we were kind of neutral about our experience (and wouldn't stay there again), I can understand why others would love it. The hotel is very trendy and chic. We stayed in the deluxe king room. The goods: The bed and pillows are super comfortable. Prob the best Iâ€™ve ever had in a hotel. The staff was very friendly. Both check in and check out was seamless. The rooms were really clean. The hotel has a really cool & young atmosphere. Itâ€™s in a great location. Itâ€™s only a block away from the downtown nightlife, and if youâ€™re planning on a trip to the house of blues, itâ€™s pretty much in the same parking lot. Itâ€™s a little further from Navy Pier and such than other hotels are, but it is walkable (we walked it) and/or taxis are cheap. Great flat screen tv. The negatives: The rooms were small and dark compared to what Iâ€™ve stayed in before. There was zero counter space (or hair dryer) in the bathroom. The â€˜atmosphereâ€™ wasnâ€™t really our style. It kind of has the atmosphere of a â€˜partyâ€™ hotel in that thereâ€™s a pretty well rounded bar in the room, the â€˜Studioâ€™ - which is like a high tech game room, Crimson Lounge is downstairs (a very popular club), the House of Blues is across the street, etc. There was nothing wrong with this, but, for example -it wouldnâ€™t be a place I would ask my parents to stay. Our telephone wasnâ€™t working and the a/c started clicking really bad for awhile. They missed our wakeup call but called and apologized. The walls are a little thin and we could sometimes hear the tv in the room next to us. Besides the hotel, cool things to do in Chicago: of course go to navy pier and stay for the fireworks. Take one of the boat tours. We took the sail boat one. Looking back, probably would have done the more traditional ones. The zoo is only so-so but good for kids. Look for the hot tix location to get discounted theatre tickets. The staff pretty much know whatâ€™s showing at every theatre in town. We saw â€˜Aliceâ€™ at the looking glass theatre. It was fantastic and great for kids and adults. The green mill was a really cool jazz bar with a lot of history (I guess it was Al Caponeâ€™s old hub). Donâ€™t go there if you want to drink and party though. They ask people not to speak while people are playing. Wrigley field was AWESOME. Andyâ€™s Jazz Club was tons of fun and thereâ€™s other bars in its proximity (that was our one night of staying up too late and drinking too much). Overall, I would definitely go back to Chicago. I feel thereâ€™s a lot we didnâ€™t get to do.

Reviews.Title: “Fell Short of Potential”
Reviews.Author: KGHTraveller
Reviews.Content: A beautiful building in the perfect location for convenient nightlife fun. Unfortunately, service and exeuction by the staff was greatly lacking. Requests (generally to fix something which was not initially right) were repeatedly dropped. They were great at apologizing, but not at recifying (or obviously preventing) issues. The Microsoft Enhanced Technology rooms are a cool idea...but they did not deliver (or even have) any of the requested and promised games or music...and their own laptops would not connect to the Internet! Not a good testimonial to either Microsoft or Hotel Sax! So close to a great spot...yet so far from delivering! We will definitely try another hotel during our next stay in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Sidhuri
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sax is hip, with great, slightly gothic (I kept thinking Interview the the Vampire meets upscale bordello meets a display of Grandma's crystal) decor and a helpful staff. The rooms are small but functional. The blackout curtains, comfortable bed and flat-screen TV were appreciated. The hotel has one of the nicest mini-bar setups we've seen for this level of hotel: martini shaker, glasses and all the trimmings (for a fee, of course); champagne and cocktail glasses; good selection of liquor and bottled water, along with candy and the usual snacks. Particularly for the price we got with Priceline, we'd certainly stay here again. The hotel is within walking distance of Michigan Avenue and the Chicago River. The valet staff was especially friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lounge downstairs...”
Reviews.Author: Spanish_Matador
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 7 nights on business travel. Initially did not get the room I had asked for (king size bed) but this was changed relatively quickly. Very nice located and for those liking Blues, this hotel is located some 10 meters from "House of Blues" only. 4th floor conference facilities are a must to see - especially the big screen they have installed. Crimson Lounge - live music every day and good dj starting 10pm. Looks like this is currently one of the places to go in Chicago nightlife :-)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel SAX Chicago, the BEST place to stay in The Windy City!!”
Reviews.Author: bergadon25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Chicago at least 1-2 times a year to visit his family. Though we have stayed at many hotels downtown, Hotel Sax is by far our favorite. First and foremost, the location within the city is ideal. Located on N Dearborn, it is walking distance from Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, etc. House of Blues is Hotel Sax Chicago's neighbor, so time your stay according to their schedule and you'll only have to walk across the parking lot. Located inside Hotel Sax is Bin36- a FABULOUS wine cafe with great wine, cheese flights, and other fare that can be paired with the perfect wine to suit your taste. Crimson Lounge is a new chicago nighttime hotspot that even has it's own "signature scent". Well known Dj's frequent here and other musical guests perform. There drink list is out of this world and though we didn't have time to order from the menu- it sounds to die for. Another location inside of adjacent to Hotel Sax is 10pin Bowling Lounge. Think martini's and fingerfoods instead of beer and pizza (though they have that too). OUR ROOM. Room#1119. Amazing. We didn't want to leave! 2 flat panel TV's mounted to the wall that consists of varying patterns- very modern eclectic. The sitting area was large enough to accomodate a small get together, though it was only my husband and I... A spacious desk with free WIFI and informative city guides and the best room service menu I've ever seen! The back wall was made up of a window that , when opened, provided a view of the city. Breathtaking. The bathroom was incredible! Large enough for a family, spacious enough for the two of us. A double vanity with products specially made for Hotel Sax. A stand up shower.. again, big enough for 2..with ideal water pressure. There was also a large tub with jets, oversized towels and perfect water temperature. My stylish husband even said that he would like to make our bathroom at home look like it with the beautiful vanity with black marble top , the black and white tiled floor, the textured wallpaper, and the beautiful curtains (can we include the view of the Chicago too?) PARKING. Close, accessible, easy....pricy. $43/night. Parking anywhere in Chicago is not cheap. Usually we park a few blocks away, but your car is usually not accessible 24/7... and who wants to drag their luggage through the city? We used the valet for parking and paid the $43/night to park and just griped to each other about it, lol. We liked knowing our car was right there and that we could get to it whenever we needed it. What can you do? It's Chicago. Complaints? Not really.. Location: Perfect. Room: Perfect. Staff: Perfect. Style: Perfect. Ammenities: Perfect (what happened to Crunch Fitness Center though???- I didn't get a workout in during our stay:( ) If I had to muster up ONE complaint.. it might be the pillows. Not the best, but my husband sells mattresses and pillows- so I may be a little spoiled. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were a little flat- but if that is the only complaint, then all in all, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Hotel Sax Chicago. You won't find a hotel that provides what Hotel Sax does. Hotel Sax, in my opinion, is by far the BEST place to stay when visiting "the Windy City".

Reviews.Title: “Treat Yourself to Luxury- Book a Stay at the Hotel Sax”
Reviews.Author: SeekHappiness34
Reviews.Content: I believe the Hotel Sax is my favorite hotel in downtown Chicago. I have stayed many places in the area but the Hotel Sax offers an extraordinary experience. From the time I pulled into the driveway, I was wowed by the level of professionalism and warmth from the staff. I knew the staff by name and they treated me like I was welcomed and my needs were a priority. Charles, the valet was more than courteous and helpful. Our housekeeper, Tonisha made us feel at home and took care of our personal items with great care, in additon to leaving the room spotless and well stocked. We had the pleasure of having a few drinks in the Crimson Lounge and met Brad and Matthew, the host and bartender. Our room was beautifully decorated and the bathroom was huge. The shower head and water pressure was fantastic! The extra two bonuses to staying at the Hotel Sax is the parking and the House of Blues. I paid ONLY $42.00 with in and outs for my entire extended stay! This is simply unherad of in downtown Chicago. The House of Blues is literally 20 steps from the Hotel Sax. Check out their website www.hob.com to see scheduled events. I will be a returning guest whenever I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “half good half bad”
Reviews.Author: blackdress
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights in May. The Bad half: I had arrived early and let them know I was there, check in was 3:00 and so I joined my party who had their rooms. I waited until 3:40 to go up to the front desk and was told my room was not ready and they would call housekeeping to get an update. In the meantime, she started to handle another guest while I stood there so I sat down on their couches and at 4:00 was motioned up to the desk. Now it was ready, they apologized and asked IF I would like a complimentary breakfast. I was still in a good mood, said it wasn't a big deal and said that's okay, turning it down. As I walked away I thought why didn't they just give it to me, why do they ask me if I want a freebeie? What they are doing is telling me they don't want to give away anything unless I am cheap enough to accept. It's just never happened to me like that and I thought it was odd. A couple hours after claiming my room I was in a state of undress and hear a knock. While I was grasping for clothes and before I could even say just a minute, the door opens and it is a hotel employee not knowing the room was taken (obviously). He got halfway in the room (I am female) and could hardly speak English enough to apologize and quickly shut the door. I didn't report it because I thought no harm done, it was a mistake and made sure I had the chain on for the rest of my stay. One morning for breakfast I joined a party of three at a table who had just ordered their breakfast. Knowing that, I didn't ask for a menu, I just asked for a cup of coffee. Twice. In the meantime, he brought them their food, etc, and never got coffee for me. It was like he was ignoring me because I came late and wasn't expected. So don't expect any special consideration from servers here , they have a high expectation of protocol. The cream on this crappy weekend came when I got home and for a whole week had $400 taken off my credit card as a "hold", meaning that amount was taken away from my purchase ability. I called the hotel and it was their room hold for incidentals. I had checked out on a Sunday yet by Thursday it was still on. They said it is up to the bank to release it. I don't know if that was a story or not, my company paid for the room, so that $400 was for my snack bar and movies? I didn't use any of extras and I checked out on Sunday, so I don't know why the hold took so long to clear. I didn't call my bank to verify who really is responsible, but I am in my 40's, stayed in rooms around the U.S. and Italy and this has never happened. It is like this hotel is too good for their own clientele and doesn't trust them . If you a good person, go with the flow, and not demanding or a diva, you may get taken advantage of like I felt I was. I probably should have done more to make a stink about all these issues as they happened, people can't take advantage of you unless you let them. However, I am of the Show-me attitude, and if you don't, I won't come back and will tell everyone I know how crappy I was treated. We are as dangerous as demanding customers. The Good: Very nice rooms, clean and good bedding, And a nice view. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: helcha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Sax from July 5-10. Unfortunately, my wallet got stolen in the Metra on my way to the hotel. The staff had been extremely helpful in assisting me in obtaining a police report, etc. Special thanks to Bernard, responsible for security. My husband and I appreciated every moment of our stay : great room on 14th floor, very comfortable bed and cleanliness everywhere. But service is really what makes the Sax different : smiles, politeness and willingness to help! We'll certainly choose the Sax again for any future stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky!”
Reviews.Author: Ksquared26
Reviews.Content: I always have my doubts about these trendy, urban places -- but Hotel Sax was very nice! Went with a girlfriend for a lady's weekend. They upgraded us to a bigger room -- which was a nice size, had a decent view, and windows that opened! There was a big flat-panel TV and a huge mirror, and two super-comfy beds. We got champagne one night when we walked into the lobby, which was nice. Because of the club on the first floor, it was a little zooy, but you couldn't hear anything up in the rooms. We also went to the Bin?? and had a great dinner. This is in a very nice location -- close to a lot of things. My only complaint was that we asked for a late checkout because of delayed flights, and they told us it would cost $150! I've never heard of that before, and was rather annoyed. But otherwise, this was a great location for a jazzy little weekend in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mstroll
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very stylish. Excellent staff. Room was fantastic. Bar downstairs very good. Excellent breakfast at Bin 34 downstairs. Location was excellent. Definitely go back to Chicago and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “How this ever was rated a 4 star hotel I will never know”
Reviews.Author: halfdoz4me
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Hotel Sax as a last minute booking because after staying at the Doubletree Magnificant Mile (which was FABULOUS and was only a 3 star) for 2 days we decided to extend our vacation by a day and were thrilled to score a 4 star...... until we got there. Upon checking in I did inquire if they knew of a parking ramp that wasn't quite so much money ($42 per night is very pricey even for Chicago) and was told there wasn't any. When the bellboy was helping unload the luggage he told my husband there was a parking ramp 1.5 blocks away for $26 per night (the ramp next to CVS on Kinzie) First we were sent to a room on the 12th floor that was a king size bed and there were 5 of us and I had confirmed the day before that we would have a nonsmoking 2 double bed room. After I contacted the front desk we got switched to a room with 2 double beds on the 11th floor that I was certain the minute I walked in was a smoking room but felt after looking around and not noting any ashtrays that maybe I was mistaken. We also had a room with a door that connected to another room which usually is never an issue but for some reason this hotel or maybe it was this door was paper thin and you could hear the family next door just having casual conversation, a hairdryer being used, the tv show they were watching and I'm sure they were just as impressed with our children settling in to a new environment. We did not stay in the room for long I truly could not stand the smell and did note that the hotel was smoke free throughout but that must be a recent thing.... the first room did not smell that they took us too but the second one was saturated in that stale smoke smell. There is no pool at this hotel, the hairdryer I could not locate until the end of my stay because they keep it in the closet in the room and not in the bathroom where one might expect to find it. The room decor was not my taste at all a bit tacky with the shadow of a chandelier on the wallpapered walls and vinyl throw pillows on the bed along with that vinyl like bucket style chair at the desk with some odd 60's like handle in the middle of the back. The wall to floor windows are nice but made me very nervous when my young child figured out that the smaller panes opened up and there is no screening and you on on the 11th floor.
